name: Marina Picaporte
headline: Technical Sound Designer at King
creator: False
school_1: Conservatorio Superior de Música de Aragón
bio:
I specialize as a music composer and sound designer within the video game industry. My collaborative experience spans across multiple game development studios, where my role involves composing music, creating intricate sound designs, and seamlessly integrating them into the game engine. I work closely with the Producer, Narrative, Art, and Development teams to ensure a cohesive and immersive audio experience.

My skill set includes:

- Proficiency in composing captivating and dynamic music across a diverse range of styles.
- Contributed to the sound design of cinematics and trailers.
- Capability to produce original and immersive sound effects tailored to their intended purpose.
- Solid understanding of musical theory.
- Extensive technical expertise in utilizing audio software, various audio formats, and file types.
- Autonomy in work, demonstrating effective time management, clear communication with other departments, and adept task management.
- Well-versed and experienced in using Digital Audio Workstations (DAWs) such as Reaper, Logic, and Pro Tools, as well as familiar with middleware like FMOD and Wwise, and game engines like Unity and Unreal.
- Knowledge of microphone setup.
- Proficient in working with Git and repositories

bio:
Product/UX UI Designer interested in creating compelling design solutions and features to increase acquisition, activation and de-risk design investment.

💡  became and UX/UI designer to utilize all my technical and creative knowledge and skills in building digital products

name: Kenny Shea Dinkin
headline: Senior Creative Director, Candy Crush Saga - [KING | X-Box] - Creative Leadership, Product Design, Strategy, Publishing.
creator: False
current_position: Senior Creative Director, Candy Crush Saga
bio:
CCO | VP & CREATIVE DIRECTOR | VP & EXECUTIVE PRODUCER | STUDIO HEAD  

Highly creative video games executive with strong interdisciplinary design talents and a unique track record leading teams and building successful businesses while driving remarkable results. Senior leadership roles at: King, Disney, PlayFirst, Mattel, The Learning Company, Broderbund, GSN, and others.

Proven expertise building hit products and slate portfolios. Highlights include, as CCO, driving PlayFirst’s game portfolio delivering over 60 games with 18 #1 hits in six years, growing Diner Dash line to 750M downloads, and as Game Designer, creating and leading The ClueFinders line to 40M$ in revenues. 

Deep expertise in game design, creative direction, executive production, building and leading game studios and publishing businesses. Specialties include IP creation, narrative design, story development, game play and puzzle design, art direction, animation, UI/UX, audio, music and voice directing for mobile and PC games. 

A passionate gamer and storyteller with a knack for people leadership and the aesthetic components of product design, blended with a keen understanding of business dynamics, market trends, monetization and retention strategies and currents in contemporary pop-culture. 

Executive Production and Creative Direction work on:
Diner Dash, Candy Crush Franchise, Reader Rabbit, Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego?, Oregon Trail, Chocolatier, Dream Chronicles, Wedding Dash, Cooking Dash, Hidden Express, The ClueFinders, Sparcade and the Sparcade tournament portfolio including Tetris Burst, Pacman, Centipede, Wheel of Fortune, Scrabble and Two Dots Tournament Editions.

MOBILE  • PC •  FREE-TO-PLAY  • CASUAL • MID-CORE • KIDS GAMES • EPISODIC  STORY

name: Pietro Amaral
headline: Principal Game Designer at King and UX Lover
creator: True
bio:
As a Designer my goal is to give the user the best immersive and functional experience, and to achieve that I use the process and methodologies to always improve my knowledge and help in the process of innovation.  My main goal as Game Designer is to create memorable experiences for my players.

I'm always willing to learn something new and I do the best that I can to give my best to what I'm doing. I like to hear what the others opinion in order to learn and think about things I didn't looked first.

name: Mick Heijkens
headline: Senior Game Designer at King
creator: False
bio:
With over a decade of experience in the gaming industry, I’m currently a Senior Game Designer at King, shaping engaging, player-first, data-driven experiences for Candy Crush Saga. I’m passionate about creating innovative, thrilling features that enhance player enjoyment while supporting business goals.

Skills and Expertise:
🎯 High-Level Vision: Defining strategic, impactful goals that drive player engagement.
🛠️ Product Design: Creating features that align with both player needs and business objectives.
🎮 Gameplay Design: Crafting intuitive, balanced mechanics and features that drive engagement.
🏆 Meta-Game Design: Designing progression systems that retain players over the long term.
💰 System and Economy Design: Building balanced, sustainable economies that enhance gameplay.
🎨 UX Design: Ensuring intuitive interfaces and smooth player experiences.
📜 Narrative Design: Weaving stories that deepen player connection and immersion.
🗺️ Level Design: Creating levels that challenge and entertain, optimizing for fun and flow.

My career began with a thesis on "Gamification in Architecture," igniting my dedication to designing gameplay that resonates with players. After leading serious gaming projects, I founded STUDiO ZiRO to explore indie game development, culminating in Backpack to the Future, a finalist entry in the Universal Game Dev Challenge. Building on these experiences, I joined King to create engaging experiences for Candy Crush Saga.

I’m a collaborative, big-picture thinker who values innovation and knowledge-sharing. My goal is to set high standards for quality design, integrating industry best practices and fostering a forward-thinking team environment.

For a closer look at my work, please visit mickheijkens.com and try my interactive resume, where you can experience my journey firsthand!

name: Elna Cabot
headline: Level Designer en King
creator: False
bio:
Multimedia Engineer, with mention in video games. I am currently working in the automotive sector in the Advance Engineering department on projects related to the connected car.

I consider myself a very hard-working, constant person who adapts to new situations. At work I am a very friendly and creative person, always ready to contribute with fresh ideas for any project.

I am currently looking to expand my knowledge acquired both at university and in my professional experience, in areas such as mobile development (apps) and videogame development.

Here is a link to the project I did at the end of my degree, 'Betrayal' an Escape Room in VR. If you want to see more information go to:

- Itch.io: https://elnacp.itch.io/betrayal

name: Sercan Caglarca
headline: Principal UX Designer
creator: False
bio:
“Hello! I am Sercan Caglarca and I’m a designer with a specialization in Interaction Design. One of my biggest passions is to use my creativity to create beautiful, effective designs through user-centered design principles.

These days, I put my hard-won skills to use finding out more about UX/UI design on a mission to simplify our needs by changing the way we interact with the digital world.

When I am not in the office working, I am either in my atelier sculpting or killing some time with my wacom tablet pushing pixels around.

More at: https://sercancaglarca.wixsite.com/portfolio
and https://www.behance.net/sercancaglarca

name: Richard Hall
headline: Senior UX Designer at King
creator: False
bio:
Senior User Experience Designer with over 10 years in the games industry. I have gained invaluable knowledge developing numerous projects for various companies and clients.

Senior UX designer in the Monetisation team (area) of Candy Crush Soda Saga. 
Responsibilities include: Leading Problem discovery, defining hypotheses and success metrics, 
 leading solution discovery. 
• Define, advocate and ensure adherence to player-centric design principles.
• Designing comprehensive UX flows for game features, documentation and prototypes in Figma.
• Member of the design team that created and implemented a Design System for the entire game.
• Facilitating workshops; problem and solution discovery and production kick offs. 
• Stakeholder management, including close collaboration with Product Managers and directors.
• Extensive experience working in a mature UX organisation - working closely with UX writers, UX researchers and UI designers. 
• Line Managing UI Designers, helping them achieve their goals.

headline: Head of Games - Studio - Product – Production – Audio – Ads
creator: False

bio:
Creative and business leader / entrepreneur.
Divergent thinker, problem solver, strong analytical skills, impact and data-driven, player oriented, infused with passion for my work and the success and happiness of my teams and products. 

Studio Director responsible for our fun, multi million dollars games: 
- Pet Rescue Saga
- Bubble Witch 3 Saga
- Candy Crush Jelly
- Candy Crush Friends
- Farm Heroes Super Saga
- Bubble Witch 2 Saga
- Pyramid Solitaire Saga
- Diamond Diaries Saga
- Blossom Blast Saga

I'm also director to the Catalog Games ads experimentation team.

name: Jose Ángel Álvarez López
headline: Lead Level Designer at King | Activision Blizzard
creator: False
bio:
I'm a Game/Level Designer with experience in the mobile Game industry in both, full-cycle development and live-ops. 

Among my duties as a Game Designer, I mainly:

- Create features and gameplay systems,
- Retention systems (events, daily/weekly login) 
- FTUE, 
- UI/UX prototypes, 
- Game balancing and progression, 

As a Level Designer, I had the opportunity to work in different genres such as runners, action games, turn-based, strategy with RPG elements and match 3 games.

I'm methodical, organised, passionate about my job always trying to give my best. I'm a proactive communicator, always eager to learn from my colleagues. I love working in teams and involving people to create the best gaming experiences.

name: Karl Odegrim
headline: Principal UI designer at King
creator: False
bio:
I've worked in the UI/UX sector close to 20 years. Always on the lookout for the "next big wow". 

I am an outgoing person who speaks my mind. My workplace must be welcoming and enjoyable. The more fun you have, the more you will enjoy your work and the more valuable your contribution will be. 

Skills in random order:
Figma, Photoshop, Aftereffects, Indesign, Illustrator, 3ds max, Maya, Sketch, Sketchup, Blender, Zbrush, Invision, Flinto, Principle, WordPress, Proto.io, XD, Spine

name: Víctor Rodríguez Fernández
headline: Senior Game Designer at King (Xbox Activision Blizzard - Microsoft)
creator: True
bio:
- "I love to make stuff" 📝

I am a Game Designer with over 9 years of experience in the gaming industry, dedicated mostly to F2P Puzzle, Strategy and games for kids with special needs. 

My mission is to design and build interactive products which bring joy to people ❤️ and empowering people in expressing themselves through game making. 🎭

I specialize in Game Design, although I am also interested in UX design and Product Management. 📈

Skills:
- Gameplay Mechanics 
- Meta-Game Design
- Level Design
- Product Design
- System and Economy Design
- UX Design
- Narrative Design

name: Claudiu Butnariu
headline: Senior Game Designer @ King
creator: False
past_company_1: Next Games, A Netflix Game Studio
bio:
I have more than 10 years experience in the Games Industry, mostly as a Game/Content Designer with decent knowledge of QA practices. In my career, I have worked on titles such as Candy Crush Saga, Stranger Things Puzzle Tales, Angry Birds 2, Alphabetty Saga, Bubble Witch, Real Racing 3, SimCity Buildit as well as several prototypes and unreleased games.

As a Game Designer, I have led and facilitated the discovery, high level design and low level design and transition into production of multiple new features and iterations of features. I use data driven techniques to inform both the creation and improvement of all features.

Skills:

-Gameplay features design
-Meta-gameplay features design
-Level/Content Design
-Systems Design
-Limited Economy Design
-Data Analysis

name: Anthony Cardentey
headline: Lead UX Designer at King
creator: False
bio:
I’m an accomplished UX designer with a broad experience in reshaping digital properties for clients from vastly different industries. My expertise lies in successfully molding business objectives, branding and consumer needs into creative solutions that resonate across customer touch points. I’m often recruited to lead UX strategies within agile teams to steer user research and validation, information architecture and cross platform design integration. In my role I push companies to rethink the way they engage with their customers across the physical and digital world. Aligning stakeholders under a creative vision that produces meaningful experiences with tangible results. 

I advocate for: Keeping it simple. Designing with customer insight. Obsessing over craftsmanship. 

Some of my specialties:
+ Contextual Inquiry 
+ Information architecture
+ Interaction design
+ Heuristic evaluation
+ Competitive benchmarking
+ Responsive interface design
+ Usability engineering

name: Rachel Pisetta
headline: Lead Experience Designer at King
creator: False
bio:
I love my work area. It helps me to grow as a person. Every day is a new challenge; I learn something different, mainly involving communication, connections, ecosystems, and tremendous empathy. 

Let me tell a bit about how I see myself and my strengths:

Daily, I get in touch with different disciplines. It leads me to continually increase my ability to understand my colleagues, the customers, the business, and operational needs for transforming knowledge into functional and relevant services. As much as possible, I involve stakeholders in the design and development process and evaluate and test solutions with the users. 

Over the last years, since 2002, I have been working with several disciplines, such as advertising, design, and user experience design. Nearly 15 years ago, I fell in love with the UX Design field and made it my focus ever since.

name: Monica Iris Andersson
headline: Narrative & Level Designer 🌿
creator: True
bio:
Hi and welcome to my page! 🫶🏻

I am a game designer with a focus in narrative. I enjoy developing complex, authentic worlds with both narrative and game design in mind for a seamless gameplay experience.

I strive to create a space for diversity and inclusivity in my storytelling because player audiences deserve representation that makes them feel seen. 

Whatever the needs of the project, my work is tailored accordingly; exploring every angle, detail, and direction a project might take. 

Simply put: You give me lemons and I’ll not only make you a lemonade, I’ll plant you a lemon tree. 🍋

creator: False

bio:
Multitalented design leader with +15 years of experience in the design field (public and private sector) driven by strategic decision making and extraordinary teamwork. Passionate about developing the talent of design teams in a healthy organizational culture and create digital products and services that solve problems and create unforgettable experiences for users.

My technical knowledge covers the full gamut of digital product and experience design, digital marketing, and communication with vast experience in coordinating design projects and leading design teams. 
   
Soft Skills: Critical thinking, communication, empathy, problem-solving, collaboration, leadership, emotional intelligence, business operations, and public speaking skills.

name: Ji Sun Stetson
headline: Product Design Leader | ADPList Mentor | Runner & Nutella lover
creator: False
bio: As the dedicated product designer for my team, I lead design initiatives across six diverse areas, driving innovation and excellence. I specialize in understanding user needs for studio monetization and ad solutions, focusing on creating seamless and engaging user experiences. I'm all about listening closely, designing thoughtfully, and delivering solutions that make life easier and more enjoyable. As I grow in my career, I'm excited to take on bigger leadership roles and tackle challenges with a positive and open mindset. My approach is all about people, combining my love for design with a commitment to teamwork and collaboration. I aim to make meaningful changes through intuitive, human-centered design that improves everyday experiences.

name: Kaja Seehafer
headline: Level Designer
creator: True
bio:
Hi I'm Kaja ✨️
I'm a level designer at KING and responsible for everything LD related in the Candy Crush Jelly Saga! 

I have experience in optimizing workflows, creating/tweaking content, onboarding and managing other designers, working on LiveOps, analyzing data, designing accessibility features, and of course documentation! 🤓😌

Working in the games industry is a real dream come true and I'm excited to see what the future holds for me. 💕👾

name: Anna Llambias
headline: Game Designer at King
creator: False
school_1: CEV. Escuela Superior de Comunicación, Imagen y Sonido
bio:
Hi there! I’m a game designer with experience in F2P new and live games. I've worked in casual and midcore projects and have experienced the full process of creation: from ideation and prototyping to soft launch and live ops.
I love to analyse F2P market and its trends to create features and mechanics that are as fun as valuable.
Thanks to my background in journalism and cinema (focused on scriptwriting) I also have a keen eye for communication, narrative and excellent written skills.

name: Peter Borell
headline: Principal UX Designer
creator: False
bio: Experienced Designer with 17 years experience of working in the design industry on both sides of the Atlantic. Currently designing experiences in mobile gaming as a UX Designer at King. bio: Games designer, writer, and lover of all things nerdy. I'm a Level Designer for King at mid-level, working on the Candy Crush Friends and Farm Heroes Saga match-3 mobile games. In my spare time, I make and play tabletop RPG content, participate in game jams, and attend conventions.

name: Angelos Malikoutis
headline: Senior UX Designer at King
creator: False
bio:
I’m a Digital Creative UX Designer with 5 years of experience in digital
products. I am passionate about combining UX Design with Digital Strategy in
order to create solid value to the company/product alongside a desirable experience to the user.

I have worked within multiple roles in order to understand and be able to
deliver a holistic approach on User Experience, fulfilling both Product and User
needs.

I thrive when working within a team and always looking forward to collaborate
with other disciplines. I am looking to explore new and challenging projects. I
believe in early documentation, inclusive culture and consistent feedback.

name: Beth Sturzbecher
headline: UX Researcher, Designer and Tutor
creator: False
bio:
UX Designer, researcher and tutor. 

Get in touch here, or by emailing bethsturzbecher@gmail.com.

I’ve spent much of my career in client facing roles working internationally, in a diverse range of industries from fine wine to HR and gaming, and find that genuine connection with people influences my designs, my views and values. I want to create products that solve the right problems. 

As a creative pragmatist, I’m excited about connecting the dots between the business, developers and creative professionals to find solutions that work for the end user.

I have a Communication Design degree and have been focusing on developing my skills as a UX designer and enhancing my UI abilities. I studied under the close guidance of some leading UX industry professionals and now, in turn, have started tutoring other UX Design students to help them on their unique paths. Portfolio can be viewed here: bethsturzbecher.com

Skills: 
UX Research | UX/UI design | User Journeys | User Personas | Information Architecture | Wireframing | Prototyping | Usability Testing | Tutoring | Branding and Logo design | Photography | Content Auditing | 

Methodologies:
Design Thinking | Atomic Design | Agile

Trivia: I also studied wine with the Court of Masters (US) and am a Certified Sommelier. 🍷

bio:
Portfolio - matheusknebel.com

I seek elegant design solutions for player-game interactions by connecting business goals with player motivations.
​
I'm senior UX Designer with academic Master’s degree in Design and research experience. 
In Candy Crush Saga, one of the biggest titles in history, I work in the Product together with PMs, Game Designers, Data Scientists and User Researchers bringing user-centered design methodologies to the table. 
In the game industry since 2009 where I worked in many startups, and also taught Game Development in a university and smaller institutions.

name: Marc Pestka
headline: Designer / Producer / Writer / Leader at King
creator: False
bio:
Pour les activités d'écriture, rendez-vous sur Dangers et Merveilles.

Since 1994, I've been working on more than 30 games (almost half have been killed, I don't list all - vae victis) at various positions (creative director, writer, game designer, level designer, producer, game content manager) from independent hypermedia art to AAA titles through licensed games, on supports ranging from next-gen consoles to mobile... and frankly speaking, what I love is just that: providing players with intense emotional experiences through ludus and paidia, thanks to the joint collaboration of awesome people.
Currently developing a solid knowledge of casual free to play games and their operations.

Ship experience also in arcade, RPG, combat, adventure, FPS, builder games.

Abilities : Design direction and implementation, vision setting, producing, project management (creation and operations), transmedia story-telling,

name: Hugo Lanchares
headline: Principal Game Designer at King
creator: False
bio:
With over 18 years of experience in computer game and software development, I excel in various key areas:

•	Outstanding in team supervision and project leadership, with a track record of leading groups of up to 20 individuals and nurturing their careers within the company.
•	Proven ability to overcome design challenges.
•	Notable for exceptional communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills.
•	Thrives in both collaborative team environments and individual tasks.
•	Demonstrates a remarkable aptitude for rapidly grasping new technologies, platforms, development environments, and application requirements.
•	Proficient in working with Unity.

My specialties include:

•	Experienced Project Leader with a deep understanding of business, strategic, and creative aspects.
•	Accomplished Game Director, responsible for shaping the overall direction and vision of games.
•	Proficient Principal Game Designer, dedicated to crafting the FTUE, core gameplay and meta experience.
•	Knowledgeable game advisor and consultant, providing expert guidance and insights.
•	Skilled in Business Development, specializing in gamification and monetization strategies.
•	Well-versed in the development of both Casual Games and Midcore Games.
•	Exceptional interpersonal skills for effective team management and motivation.

In addition to my leadership and team management skills, I bring a valuable understanding of AI applications.

name: Austin Whitaker
headline: Illustrator and Concept Artist
creator: False
bio:
Hello there! I am a VisDev and Concept Artist with a focus on character design and an intense passion for storytelling. With music in my ears and color at my whim, I craft imaginative and explorative worlds drawn from the well of inspiration within myself. My need to create is unbridled and unrestrained, and I love nothing more than to bring ideas into reality. 

Interests:
- Concept Art
- Character Design
- Illustration
- 2D Animation
- Voice Acting

Proficiencies:
- Clip Studio Paint
- Adobe After Effects

name: Marina Fuentes
headline: Senior UX/UI Designer at King
creator: False
school_1: Elisava School of Design and Engineering
bio:
Hi, I'm Marina! I'm a UX/UI Designer based in Barcelona. I have special eye for detail and passion for design ✨

How do I work?
• I'm pixel-perfect, which means I'm not happy if I don't deliver the highest quality I can.
• I know how to work hand-in-hand with PO's and devs during the transfer from design to development.
• I am flexible, responsible and love to create a fun and enjoyable work environment by collaborating as a team.
• I always think one step further, on how to make a solution engaging (gammification) and innovative and I'm constantly willing to learn new cool stuff.
• I specialize in visual design, but I'm experienced creating products from scratch or using a DS going throught all design stages (research, testing, ideation, high fidelity, prototyping, etc). This allows me to think about all factors while designing and create the best possible solution.

My working tools 🛠️
Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, Principle, 3D Blender, Jira, Confluence, Miro, Post-its and markers :)

name: Stacey Howsham
headline: UX Designer
creator: False
bio:
www.staceyhowsham.com

My background in customer care and experience gives me a great insight into how users interact with a product, be that a physical or digital one.  

I have a passion for design thinking and helping people and although my career has been predominantly reactive in Customer Support when users have issues, my move to UX is to bring my knowledge and experience to help prevent these user issues and create an enjoyable experience.  

Having worked in the customer service sector since leaving school this is something I am extremely passionate about. I believe that Customer Care and Experience is the most important aspect of any company even coming above sales, if you look after your customers the sales will come.

name: Oriol de Dios
headline: Game Designer at King
creator: False
school_1: ECIB | Escola de Cinema de Barcelona
school_2: Centre de la Imatge i la Tecnologia Multimèdia | CITM (UPC)
bio:
Videogame Designer, Videogame Developer, Board Game Designer.

I've been designing and developing Videogames during my videogames degree in the university. I have experience in scripting, gameplay designing, C++ programming and working with videogame engines like Unity.

I've recently founded the first Game Design Magazine of my University and I'm currently developing my first board game.

Im currently on King as an Inter Game Designer.

See more about me and my projects here: https://orioldedios.jimdosite.com/

Also check my last Board game project here: https://oriboardgames.jimdosite.com/

name: Carlos Casado
headline: Principal Game Designer @ Candy Crush Saga
creator: False
past_company_2: UNIR Universidad Internacional de La Rioja
bio:
As Principal Game Designer on the Core Gameplay team for Candy Crush Saga, my role involves a deep responsibility for the overall player experience and the mechanics that keep the game engaging, exciting and fresh over time. 
I am at the forefront of defining and refining the core gameplay loops, ensuring they remain enjoyable while meeting the business objectives, from ideation to release.

name: Marina B.
headline: Game Designer | 3D Artist
creator: False
bio:
Hardworker, charismatic and responsable person who loves videogames. 
I grew up with videogames and now I want to make them. Next level unblocked, let's play!

If you want to know more about me, I’d love to arrange a time to speak about me, my work and what I am looking for in further detail.

bio:
I'm a Senior UI Designer based in Stockholm, passionate about all kinds of visual arts. 
🎓 Graduated from University of Buenos Aires - FADU Faculty of Architecture, Design and Urbanism.
Specialised in UI/UX design leadership for desktop and mobile platforms.
👾 +10 years experience working in the Gaming Industry. Most of my recent work has been focused on mobile games and social media art.
I consider myself a great team player, always looking for professional execution and high-quality visuals.

name: Esther Hong
headline: Senior UI Designer at King
creator: False
school_1: Kaywon University of Art and design
school_2: 한국 애니메이션 고등학교 korea Animation High school
bio:
Esther Hong is a Game UI & UX designer, with 12+ years of experience in the gaming industry and enthusiasm for making games. She has been involved in several large and small projects and has taken on the whole development process from concept to realisation. She can cover all graphic departments of game production, specialising in UI design. She focuses on the visualisation of ideas and concept screens with consideration of player’s behaviour. She is interested in collaborating with engineers and designers for optimal output.

You can check the portfolio page by clicking here.
https://hosdo0307.myportfolio.com

name: Zack Keller
headline: Narrative Director | Writer
creator: True
bio: I'm a writer and director for TV, feature films, videogames and comic books, currently working as a Narrative Director at King and a creator/writer at Dark Horse Comics. After beginning my career at Pixar Animation Studios, I co-created Dick Figures, the highest-rated animated web series on YouTube which earned nearly a billion views and an Annie Award nomination. At Telltale Games, I was a lead writer and narrative designer for such award-winning franchises as Guardians of the Galaxy, Batman, The Walking Dead and Tales from the Borderlands. Most recently, I was a screenwriter for Cartoon Network’s animated series Unikitty!, produced by Warner Brothers Animation and The LEGO Group, and wrote the graphic novels "Cuphead: Comic Capers & Curios" and "Hotel REM" for Dark Horse Comics.

name: Brenda Montes
headline: Senior UI Designer
creator: False
school_1: Centro Universitario de Arte, Arquitectura y Diseño
bio:
I am a Senior UI/UX Designer working in the games industry (based in Stockholm, Sweden). I’ve been making digital products for more than ten years. I have designed digital experiences for a wide variety of businesses, including websites, apps, mobile games, the self-service industry, etc.

I’m passionate about improving the product through user experience using the Design Thinking methodology. My favorite part of the process is discovery, so right now, I'm very into research/ user-centered, etc.

I’m creative, believe in the power of good documentation, cooperative with my team, and believe in creating products based on user needs, balancing business but putting experience first.

I have experience developing wireframes, usability tests, user research, planning content, responsive interfaces, and interaction design. 

I enjoy a work environment that inspires me never to stop learning and where I can expand my potential. 

My hobby is illustrating, both in digital and traditional media; I'm always looking for creative projects where this hobby can be applied to enrich an experience.

name: Jeronimo Saez
headline: Lead UI Designer at King
creator: False
bio:
I'm a professional interface designer with a vast experience working on UI Design in AAA video games.
Right now, I’m working as Lead UI Designer at King.
On my previous position, as Principal UI Designer at Frontier Developments, I lead the UI design on the awesome Elite Dangerous.
Before that, I was the Lead UI/UX Designer of Master Of Orion, the reboot of the classic strategy game.
And even before, I've been working on Electronic Arts AAA gaming projects (since 2008), on incredible franchises such as FIFA, NEED FOR SPEED, NHL and others.

Specialties: Interface Design, User Experience Design, Interaction design, Motion Graphics.

name: Franco Ottaviano Sans
headline: Motion Designer
creator: False
bio:
https://www.behance.net/francoottacb4c

Hola! Soy Franco y estoy buscando trabajo remoto alrededor del Motion Graphics, la postproducción y los efectos especiales. Con más de 5 años de experiencia como Motion Designer, soy flexible a nuevos flujos de trabajo, fan de la comunicación clara y motivado a encarar el siguiente proyecto. Acostumbrado a la        planificación efectiva y al trabajo bajo presión, priorizando siempre la fecha de entrega.

• Retoque digital y montaje profesional de imágenes mediante Photoshop.
• Animación avanzada de Motion Graphics a través de After Effects.
• Post-producción y VFX
• Edición y montaje de vídeo y audio.
• Modelado 3D.

creator: False
bio:

*With 9 shipped titles on Mobile/PC/Web platforms
*Ability to adapt within a variety of creative styles.

*Ability to adapt within a variety of creative styles

*Interface with project stakeholders to ensure the UX reflects customer needs

name: Jacqueline Berghuis
headline: User Experience Designer with a proven track in Brand Design.
creator: False
bio:
User Experience Designer | Brand Designer

As a User Experience Designer, I want to build unique user-focused and profitable digital products according to their brand strategy.

I am very happy with my role as UX designer at King!
My apologies for not updating my profile. I will asap. 

How I became a UX designer?After completing the UX/UI design bootcamp, I accepted the internship program at King to continue learning and to broaden my experience to a new industry and tech company. This amazing experience brought me a deeper understanding of the mobile gaming industry in general and the specific knowledge on how to design and run experiments to improve players’ experience and engagement. I participated from beginning to end to an experiment in a game and parallel I worked with the team that is starting a new way of doing experiments based on Lean UX. 

End 2019 I finished a bootcamp of UX/UI design and I am very excited to have discovered that this is the field I was looking for. The course brought me a deeper understanding of digital usability and enriches my background as a brand designer. I am eager to become more knowledgeable in UX/UI design and therefore I offer my extensive experience to expand my skills. I am at ease both with being self-motivated and working independently, as with working as part of a team. However to reach my goal I prefer to be part of an experienced UX/UI team.

My experience in brand design taught me that working from a unique concept idea ensures that the different brand expressions are distinctive and coherent. I believe that in User Interface design this expertise can make the difference in the development of richer user experience. I will elevate team diversity and bring a broader view on digital products or services.

Please feel free to contact me, always open to listen and share my experience.

name: Ida Andersson-Junkka
headline: Senior Game Designer at King
creator: False
bio: Passionate about delivering an experience and observing a response from the receiver, I am driven by the fact games are such powerful tools of communication! Through a game, a player is part of a tale as you wish to tell it. Through a game, you can build an emotional and meaningful connection with another person. Games bring people together through shared experiences, with real impact on our lives.

name: Darya Mironava
headline: Senior Game Designer at Activision Blizzard King
creator: False
bio:
I'm a gaming industry professional with 7 years of experience. Passionate about game design and content creation. Multilingual (native Belarusian and Russian, fluent English and upper intermediate Swedish).

Initially, my background lies in the field of international relations and politics (2+ years focusing on PR & communications, as well as project management). At the moment I'm happy to be applying all the experience and skills I've accumulated in the creative field of game development, which I love. 

I'm interested in developing further experience in game design and UX and devote my free time to studying these fields.

name: Attila F. Szenczi-Molnar
headline: Principal Game Designer @ King | Game Design, Product, & Mentor
creator: False
bio:
As a Principal Game Designer at King, I lead design decision-making and processes for some of the most popular casual games on the App Stores, such as Candy Crush Saga, Pet Rescue Puzzle Saga, and Bubble Witch 3 Saga. I have over six years of experience in creating engaging and accessible free-to-play and mobile games for millions of players worldwide.

My core competencies include F2P game design (specifically for innovation and growth), LiveOps and seasonal frameworks, short-to-long-term engagement, line management & skill development, and building teams using agile production methodologies. 

I hold an MSc in Game Design from Full Sail University, where I also served as a guest lecturer for Bachelor's students majoring in Game Design and Production. I am a Certified Professional Scrum Product Owner, and a Certified Advanced ScrumMaster. I am passionate about advancing in the field of game design and sharing my knowledge and insights with the game development community. I am also a published academic researcher have published research articles on mobile game accessibility heuristics and guidelines in Game Developer magazine.

name: Oriol Quilez Cuenca
headline: Lead UX Designer at Candy Crush Saga
creator: False
bio:
Enjoying to work on all kinds of projects by engaging myself with the best teams.

Do you know how I can do that?
By being one more of the team, helping them when needed, making decisions, and talking with other teams/clients to understand their goals and problems. My background in computer engineering gives me the knowledge of how to speak not only with business but also with development teams.  

Defining myself as only a UX designer would be inaccurate; I’m lucky to actively participate with my colleagues in the product strategy definition, research, and design phases of almost every project, providing me with a 360º view of the projects and a diverse experience. 

Industry experience: Worked on projects for mobile gaming, automotive, delivery, food, sports, security, recruiting, and media industries for international and start-up companies.

name: Maíra T.
headline: Principal Narrative Designer at King
creator: False
bio: Leading Narrative Design for "Candy Crush Soda Saga." With over 13 years in the game industry, I've crafted stories for mobile titles like "Relic Hunters: Rebels" and various casual free-to-play games. Throughout my career, I've taken on diverse roles covering narrative design, UX, and game economy. Fluent in English and Portuguese, blending linguistic skills and creative writing to engage players worldwide.

name: Julia Nilsson
headline: UI designer at King
creator: False
past_company_2: Glorious Games Group AB (prev. Stardoll AB)
bio:
Hi there! I'm a Game artist. 
I graduated from Futuregames in 2018. 

​My strongest skills lie in 2D concepts (character/environment/props) and storytelling. 
I can easily adapt to new art styles, and also experienced making mood boards/style guides, story-boarding, UI, basic 3D modelling & texturing.

I'm a positive, empathetic person with a positive outlook on life, a dedicated team-player. Nothing is more  fulfilling for me than being creative and having fun working together with others. 
Some things I love other than art, are animals, indie games, gaming with friends, D&D.

headline: Graphic Designer at King
creator: False
bio:
Over the past 18 years, I have built a broad skillset within both traditional and digital media. 

Currently I am responsible for designing and facilitating CRM alongside partnership pitch & presentation projects within the largest titles in the mobile gaming industry.

name: Hernan Gonzalez
headline: User Interface Designer at King 🍭 Making the World Playful
creator: False
school_1: BAU, Centre Universitari d'Arts i Disseny
top_skill_2: Diseño de la interfaz de usuario
bio:
I specialize in interface design for mobile games, native mobile and web-based apps (iOS, Android and Web). Currently working on the interface design for Candy Crush Saga, a big challenge considering it's a game that boasts over 230 million monthly active users.

My goal is to design memorable and fun games that inspire and entertain players over the world by creating visually appealing and intuitively navigable interfaces, ensuring both functionality and aesthetic excellence.

My expertise spans the complete design lifecycle, from initial user research through to prototyping, testing, and final implementation. I have worked on different industries and types of softwares and applications. This also includes using advanced tools and multiplatform game engines, which has enabled me to effectively contribute to and innovate in various game development projects.

 I thrive in dynamic, agile environments, collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams to translate user needs and product objectives into practical, innovative design solutions. Working closely with product, art, engineers, I leverage my deep understanding of both the technical possibilities and constraints within mobile gaming to devise strategies that not only improve player and user experiences but also drive business value. 

Through my career, I have consistently demonstrated the ability to respond adaptively to evolving project requirements, ensuring that all design initiatives are aligned with the latest trends and industry standards in mobile gaming and other industries following Material Design and Human Interface Guidelines.

Key Specialties and Tools:

- UI/UX Design: Expertise in product and interface design tailored to enhance user interaction within mobile games, web and apps.

- Prototyping and Wireframing: Skilled in developing wireframes and prototypes using Figma, Sketch, and Invision, facilitating effective communication of design concepts.

- Design Systems and Tools: Proficient in creating and maintaining design systems following Material Design and Human Interface guidelines using Figma and Adobe Creative Suite for high-fidelity design production. 

- Collaboration and Project Management: Adept at using JIRA, Confluence, Microsoft Office 365, and Google Workspace to streamline workflow and enhance team collaboration.

- Cloud Solutions: Experienced in leveraging cloud storage options like Dropbox and Google Drive for efficient resource management and team accessibility.

headline: UI designer
creator: False
bio:
I have been working for the Game Artist, especially in the area of the overall game graphics, concept art, UI and animations for mobile apps. Almost all launching game apps were fulfilled successfully for the company, also have been working professionally for a long time which I can mention presenting original but productive drawing, either have the highly technical knowledge to offer my desires and ideas of the Game.

The design plays a significant role in every game and every part of showing things. So thinking like a user is the most important to me because they are the primary purpose and object to present one's Game. Usually, people want to be part of somewhere when they are interested. Thus my goal is to satisfy the customer's needs and wants, also contributing to the team culture and providing high-quality work.

name: Joaco Barcala
headline: UX/UI Designer
creator: False
school_2: Universidad Católica del Uruguay 'Dámaso Antonio Larranaga'​
bio:
UX/UI Designer with 10yr background in filmmaking and content creation. 
As a designer I am driven to craft functional and creative digital products based on user-centered design and design thinking methodologies. I’m looking to be part of projects that deliver meaningful and impactful digital experiences to their users.

Working as a freelancer has given me experience in dealing with clients as well as developed my communication and presentation skills towards a problem-solving mindset, always tackling projects with a global vision of the business goals and its needs.

As a filmmaker I earned a lot of experience in storytelling and became a very empathic, curious and detail-oriented person, “a must” if you want to connect with people and brands when telling their stories.

I am used to both being part of teams and leading small teams, and I always rely on hard work and collaborative processes to get the best results.

For project proposals or just sharing ideas over a coffee, write me to: joacobarcala@gmail.com



Behance Portfolio: https://www.behance.net/joacobarcabcd4

Interest in: UX/UI Design, Product Design, Web Design, Game Design, NFT, Blockchain
Design Thinking, Agile, User-Centered Design, Gamification, Content Design, Service Design
Figma, Human-Centered Design

bio:
Mi misión es ayudar a las empresas a conocer mejor a sus usuarios: quiénes son, cuáles son sus necesidades, expectativas y deseos, e incorporar estos conocimientos a través de todo el proceso de desarrollo de producto.

name: Leticia Aguiar
headline: Junior Motion Designer at King
creator: False
past_company_2: Deutsch Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH
bio:
Hi, my name is Letícia, I’m an Illustrator and Animator from Brazil, currently living in the UK. I work both traditionally and digitally on Photoshop and Illustrator and animate in After Effects. 

I've worked as a consultant for Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ), producing the drawings and animation for videos about Ecosystem-based Adaptation, in whiteboard style. Also, I've got experience working with Communication Agencies, for various types of clients, illustrating for social media. Lastly, I've also illustrated for companies like Muster Ventures and BTI (Break The Ice), influencers, such as Luarices, illustrated posters and materials for Kindergartens in Brazil, and animated intros for courses such as Beyond the Cloud, Clube Click Cel and AS+.

I think it’s important to keep innovating, so I’m really happy to take on new styles and challenges.
I love art and being able to tell stories through drawing and animation. My goal is to bring to life stories that inspire.

You can check my portfolio here: https://www.behance.net/letasaur
Feel free to contact me with any enquiries!

name: Víctor Sierra
headline: Junior Level Designer at King
creator: False
bio:
☛ I'm a Game Designer with a strong focus on Gameplay and Level Design, with a background on Narrative. Skilled in creative vision work, prototyping and project management, with 5 years worth of experience.

📋 I have a mix of indie and AAA experience, spanning F2P mobile Match 3 up to Hack N Slash ARPGs. I love building and materializing creative visions in highly agile and creative teams, with a knack for leaning into my technical and production backgrounds to empower my team's decisions!

✔️ I thrive in open communication enviroments with player-experience-oriented mindsets and data-oriented decision making where everyone contributes to a shared creative goal; to create evoking, meaningful player experiences. Nice to meet you! ✌️

name: Romi Nicole Schneider
headline: Creative Designer | Activision Blizzard King
creator: True
bio:
Creative designer and photographer. Some of the things I do:

• Creative ideation, concept and design development across platforms and mediums

• Work with stakeholders briefs and data to deliver high quality results

• Art direction and photography of people, places, products, events and lifestyle

• Illustration, pattern making, character design, content creation

• A complete brand refresh, logo design and brand identity, brand guidelines, signage and stationary

• Projects on a big scale with multiple deliverables across print and digital

• Working with tools and systems to maximise efficiency and clear workflows 

• Hand craft design processes such as printing techniques, screen printing, letterpress, dark room

• Blog about places and experiences

name: Vittorio Truffarelli
headline: Senior UI Designer | Visual Designer | Game Maker
creator: True
bio:
Vittorio is a Visual Designer with over 10+ years of experience in the tech industry, focusing on UI Design and Branding in gaming.

Over the past decade, I've been crafting gaming experiences, contributing to major studios like Good Game Studios and Wooga, and indie successes such as Starberry Games and Mighty Bear Games. 
My journey has taken me from London to Berlin and now to Singapore, providing a global perspective on visual design and innovation.

Beyond gaming, my freelance endeavors include a significant collaboration with Deutsche Welle, enhancing the visuals of their Planet B YouTube channel.

name: Ida Bark Bjurman
headline: Lead UX Designer - Candy Crush Soda
creator: True
bio:
Hello, I'm Ida, a seasoned UX professional with over a decade of experience. My passion lies in finding joy and inspiration in every facet of my work. I firmly believe that when work is enjoyable, it fuels exceptional performance and motivates me to reach for greatness.

My approach centers on seeking out opportunities rather than dwelling on problems, and I thrive in agile, efficient work environments. Having dedicated a substantial portion of my career to the field of UX, I've cultivated a deep appreciation for continuous learning and growth. I am driven by the pursuit of pushing boundaries, both for myself and the talented individuals I collaborate with, in our collective quest to discover innovative and superior ways of working.

name: Nemanja Popović
headline: Senior UX desinger @ King
creator: False
bio:
I developed a fascination with programming and design when I got my computer as a gift from my dad as a mid-school graduation gift. For nearly two decades of my appreciation for gradients and whitespace, layout and type and animation have yielded designs that are elegant yet approachable. Fell in love with games and programming in my college years, now fluent in CSS and HTML and bit of JS. Also developed visual skills due to involvement with a different range of projects in my career. 

As a product designer, I always wanted to make features and products that are accessible and easy to use, tried to make data-driven design decisions based on research and always go a little extra on the visual side, so the product looks and feels good.

So, whether I'm whipping up intuitive interfaces or giving my cat VIP treatment, one thing's for sure: I'm all about creating experiences that are as cool  as the first time you saw a cat play the keyboard on YouTube. Let's connect and see if we can cook up some design magic together! 🪄🐾

name: Elias Chafloque
headline: Data Products & Visualization at King
creator: False
bio:
I specialize in transforming data into user-centric solutions for the mobile gaming industry. I develop end-to-end products—from data pipelines and backend services (Node, Python) to reporting and interactive visual applications (frontend technologies, BI tools)—ensuring that complex data and processes are presented clearly, enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions.

My goal is not only to solve technical challenges but also to deliver valuable insights that support strategic decision-making.

creator: False
bio:
Senior Technical Sourcer at King, part of Activision Blizzard and King, now also xbox Gaming Studios.

My focus is sourcing Senior Talent into our Product, Engineering, and Game Production teams for King across EMEA.

Some of the roles I hire for are Engineering Managers, Product Directors, Senior Product Managers, Senior Producers, and Senior Engineers. 

If you are interested in working for a leading mobile gaming studio with some of the biggest game titles ever then please get in touch.

name: Muriel Garreta Domingo
headline: UX Research Director
creator: False
bio:
I am a passionate User Researcher and Designer: finding out about users' needs and wants and looking for solutions to cover these "gaps" is what I enjoy doing. 

I am a true believer that qualitative and quantitative analysis go hand in hand. As a researcher, I want to both understand the "why" and know the "what". Currently, I am focussing my work on knitting this relationship between qual and quant, on the "jobs to be done framework" and trying the "sense & respond" approach in as many instances as it's possible. 

I also enjoy being a more academic researcher. Here's a URL with a list of most of my papers: https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Muriel_Garreta_Domingo.

name: Tobias H.
headline: UI/UX at King
creator: False
current_position: Assoc. Principal UI/UX Designer, New Games
bio: With over 15 years of experience in mobile gaming, I was part of the team that worked on King's first project on Facebook, contributing to the company's early successes. As a founding member of the Candy Crush Soda team, I played a pivotal role in its development and growth over seven years. Additionally, I designed the iconic app icons for both Candy Crush Saga and Candy Crush Soda, which have become globally recognized. My work on various game features has since become a standard across multiple titles. Currently, I bring my expertise to King's New Games department, shaping the future of engaging and innovative gaming experiences.

bio:
I believe design has the power to tell stories, deepen engagement, transform brands, and grow business. I design brands with purpose & websites with style.
I am a designer with with an integrated professional profile and experience in UX, branding, UI, digital design & production. I've worked with several innovative design agencies and brands worldwide, creating digital products that engage and captivate audiences successfully materialising brief into online experiences. 
Ten years ago, I brought my creative mind to Barcelona, where I've developed comprehensive identities and online experiences for beauty, fashion & lifestyle brands. Her work has been featured in some of the most renowned design publications.
With a professional history that began with this century, she has lived and worked in America & Europe, discovering that the world is a handkerchief.

name: Doug Kaufman
headline: Design Director at King
creator: False
current_position: Design Director Candy Crush Soda Saga
bio:
I've been in the games industry since the early 1980's, first in board games and then in computers. From 1990 on I've worked with multiple platforms and on multiple genres, including arcade shooters, flight sims, strategy games, animated graphic adventures, RPGs, console RPGs, and online family-friendly games.

Specialties: I've been told at one time or another that my specialties are Being able to evaluate an unfinished product for Fun and Pacing; Being able to ask all the right questions to keep a project moving forward, and Being able to see the big picture. I happen to think my specialty is in being able to analyze where and how to apply design resources to get the most bang for the buck.

name: Simon Loche
headline: Senior Art Director | Microsoft XBox | Activision Blizzard King | x-Amazon, x-Gameloft, x-Scopely, x-Outfit7
creator: True
bio:
Senior Art Director, Senior Concept Artist in the Video Game industry and Comic Book Artist.

I provide quality direction, management, artworks and assets for the entertainment industry.
Specialties: Art Direction, Visual Development, Concept Art, Character Design, Story Boarding, Sequential Art, Outsourcing Management...

Seasoned Senior Art Director with over two decades of experience in the gaming and entertainment industries, I currently lead the artistic vision at Microsoft Activision Blizzard King, where I've been since January 2022.

I had different roles in my career, including Art Director at Scopely, Outfit7, Gameloft in Barcelona, Space Ape Games in London and Amazon Game Studios in Los Angeles, and freelance Concept Artist for renowned companies such as Warner Bros Animation, Sony Entertainment, and Gearbox.

With a strong background in Concept Art, Visual Development, Team Leadership, Mobile Games, Game Development, and Vendor Management, I excel in creative strategy and communication.
My expertise also includes guiding teams, developing visual styles, and managing art production to align with gameplay and narrative goals.

Currently based in Barcelona, I thrive in hybrid work environments, continually pushing the boundaries of visual excellence in game development.

name: Smailing Ventura
headline: Product Designer at King, UX Management lecturer, and Mentor for Aspiring Designers | 🌱  Plants geek
creator: True
past_company_1: Elisava Escola Universitària de Disseny i Enginyeria de Barcelona
past_company_2: ESDAP - Escola Superior de Disseny i d'Arts Plàstiques
bio:
I am a Product Designer with 16+ years of experience in UX, Design Management, User Interface, and now 📱👾 Mobile Games 🍭🕹️. My primary motivation is inspiring creativity, interaction, and collaboration to create memorable experiences that makes the world playful.

My background in sociology is my secret sauce—it helps me get into users' minds, figuring out not just what they need but also what will make them smile. I’m in my element when mixing visuals that pop with experiences that stick.

If you’re up for crafting experiences that blend fun with function and Impact, if you just want to talk about the latest in mobile gaming or even how to revive your Monstera, let’s chat.

name: Oliver Graff
headline: UX Ninja at King 👑 | MC at UX Salon Barcelona
creator: True
bio:
International proactive & resourceful problem solver.

With my UX/UI design skills aligned with my business background, and my ability to be adaptable; I can promise that I will create purpose driven user experiences for your clients and your business goals.

From Stockholm, based in Barcelona.

—

A degree in International Business Management & Marketing (Uppsala University ) and 5+ years business consulting experience, working on a variety of projects for clients in Europe. I wanted to develop skills within tech and design so I learned UX/UI (Ironhack Barcelona) and I am always hungry to learn in order to create products that provide value to all parties involved.

—

Winner of the UX/UI Hackshow at Ironhack, December 2020.

—

Design Thinking | User Research | Figma | Sketch | InVision | Adobe CC | HTML | CSS | JavaScript | Business Thinking

Hope to hear from you soon.

name: Gabriela Vera Marún
headline: C++ Developer at King
creator: False
bio:
Ingeniera Electrónica, con casi 10 años de experiencia en la programación de microcontroladores (sistemas embebidos). Programación en C avanzada, con conocimiento de C++. Interesada en la programación y diseño de aplicaciones en general (alto o bajo nivel), haciendo uso de metodologías de desarrollo de software como por ejemplo TDD.

Experiencia en el desarrollo de sistemas supervisorios con conocimientos en otras áreas como automatización, control y un poco de telecomunicaciones.

Herramientas de gestión de proyectos: JIRA, SCRUM.
Herramienta para control de versiones: SVN, GIT
Manejo avanzado de IDEs: MPLAB, MPLABX, IAR Embedded Workbench,
Manejo avanzado de lenguajes de programación: C.
Manejo avanzado de microsoft office: word, excel, power point.
Manejo de IDEs: Freescale Codewarrior, Matlab, Labview, Multisim y P-spice. 
Manejo de Visual Studio 2010 y C#, C++ y Assembler.
Manejo de IDEs de Yokogawa: SCADA FAST/TOOLS (despliegues, bases de datos y HMI) y Logic Designer del controlador STARDOM.

name: Hector Fernandez
headline: Hardware Designer and Firmware Developer
creator: False
bio:
Soy ingeniero industrial con una sólida formación en diseño de hardware y programación de microcontroladores. A lo largo de mi carrera, he evolucionado hacia la programación en lenguajes de alto nivel, ampliando mis habilidades y conocimientos en diversas áreas tecnológicas.

Aunque comencé mi carrera en el ámbito de la ingeniería electrónica, mi pasión por la programación me ha llevado a ser autodidacta en múltiples lenguajes y tecnologías. Por ejemplo, he adquirido experiencia en Web Design (HTML5, PHP, JavaScript, NodeJS y Angular), C#, desarrollo de aplicaciones Android y scripts de Python.

Mi objetivo es especializarme en un campo específico de la ingeniería, sin dejar de lado el aprendizaje continuo en otras áreas transversales. Este enfoque me permitirá, en el futuro, liderar equipos de ingenieros, organizando tareas de manera eficiente y afrontando las particularidades y desafíos de diversas tecnologías y lenguajes de programación.

Estoy comprometido con la mejora constante y la adquisición de nuevos conocimientos, siempre buscando oportunidades para aplicar mis habilidades en proyectos innovadores y desafiantes.

name: Javier Barnes
headline: Principal Product Manager at King // Game Economy & F2P Monetization Specialist // Opinions are my own
creator: True
bio:
Check more about me at jb-dev.net
I'm a well-rounded game designer, with +10 years of experience in the free-to-play mobile market.
I believe that to succeed on mobile, a game needs to be SUPER fun and EXTREMELY engaging.
Having excellent Marketing, Monetization and Art is only part of the drill.

My personal objective, and the way how I evaluate success in my own work, is to create great games that players remember for a lifetime. And place them on the top-grossing positions on the AppStore : )

name: Joe Baxter-Webb [Ph.D. SFHEA]
headline: Game Design & Creative Leadership
creator: False
current_position: Content Creator - Games Criticism & Design Education
bio:
Game designer and “full stack creative” with 15 years experience between games/media production and related teaching. 

Previously responsible for game design and creative leadership at Karta, making Roblox and Fortnite experiences for a range of clients. In my most recent 4-year stint in academia I helped to design and lead the Game Design degree at CCCU ranked in the top 3 nationally. Prior to this I worked as a creative producer, narrative, level and economy designer at a small mobile games studio which made games in collaboration with clients including Mediatonic, Adult Swim Games, and Turner Broadcasting.

My practical experience ranges from small experimental art games and bots, to F2P mobile games, and more recently making metaverse/UGC maps and experiences with Karta. I’m happiest in situations where I can contribute in a hands-on way, whether that be to level design, UI and UX, game narrative, or progression and economy. 

I'm passionate about board-games and tabletop roleplaying games, and anything which encourages creativity, problem-solving and expressiveness in players. I also have an interest in music production and video editing, and have designed several non-digital games.

creator: False
bio:
Experienced software engineer with over thirteen years of diverse programming expertise, primarily focused on frontend development with additional experience in backend technologies. My career spans across a wide array of projects, including mobile games, game servers, MedTech applications, rich internet applications, online communities, campaign sites, e-learning platforms, and more. Holding a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, I've honed my skills primarily in C++ over the last six years, complemented by proficiency in Python, SQL, C#, Java, and JavaScript.

Currently, I thrive as a Game Developer at King, specializing in Monetization and Economy for renowned titles such as Candy Crush Saga and Candy Crush Soda Saga. Prior to my software engineering journey, I ventured into web design, backed by a Bachelor of Arts in Information Design.

headline: Engineering Manager at King

bio:
I am a software engineer with a great passion in computer graphics.
I am a game developer and I create app for Android and iOS with C++, ReactNative or Flash ActionScript 3.0 and Air platform.
I can develop software application with VB.Net, C, C++ and Java.
I can write web application using PHP, XML and Flash Actionscript 3.0.
I learned how to use 3D graphics programs like Maya and Rhinoceros.
I would like to develop my skill in 3D graphics modeling and programming.

name: Artemis Georgakopoulou
headline: Software Engineer/Game Developer at King Activision Blizzard
creator: False
bio:
Over the course of my studies, I learned various skills related to Computer Engineering. Specifically, I focused on the programming sector. I learned multiple programming languages and programming on different platforms, both solo and as a part of a team. At the end of my studies I focused on Graphics programming, Spatial Augmented Reality and Interactive Applications, which was also in the topic of my Dissertation Thesis.

In addition, I completed my studies for a Masters Degree on Advanced Programming for AAA Video Games in UPC. With this course I aimed to deepen my low level programming knowledge and be prepared to work professionally on tasks regarding graphics programming, as well as games and tools.

The last couple of years, I entered the gaming industry and worked professionally on serious games, as well as casual games. My experience includes C++, C#, Unity, Unreal and other custom game engines. 

As a continuation of my carrer I would like to keep working on game-like applications that assist people in having entertaining, educational, immersive experiences.

name: David Marí
headline: Director Of Engineering at King
creator: False
bio:
— My opinions are my own —

Computer Engineer with experience in the full process of desktop and web applications creation & expert FreeBSD sysadmin.

Interested in Internet projects and enhancing the user experience, as well as surveillance projects, distributed architechtures.

High capacity for learning new technologies or adapting to new environments.

Able to manage my own time.

I've been in charge of:

- Architecture, design and development of SIV-L9 project, video surveillance system for Lines 9 and 10 of "Metro de Barcelona", built on top of a self-made failure-resilient distributed architecture.

- Mail service systems administration for "Consejo General de Colegios Oficiales de Médicos de España", at about 20,000 users, for more than seven years.

- Migration of physical servers to IaaS (infrastructure as a service) platforms in the cloud.

I've been part of:

- SINCERT: platform for Certification Authorities syndication and Attribute Authority, and its presentation at the European Commission in Brussels, in collaboration with HProCard project from the Council of French Physicians Orders.

- Assistance in the creation of the Internet platform to comply with the Spanish Omnibus law for "Consejo General de Colegios Oficiales de Médicos de España".

Specialties: Distributed systems, Web, Internet, FreeBSD, Webservices, PHP, Java EE

name: Greta Septinia
headline: Senior UX Writer at King | Content Designer
creator: False
bio:
Hello! I'm a UX writer based in Stockholm. 

As a data-driven designer, I go beyond crafting impactful copies. I also collaborate closely with Product Designers, UX Researches and developers to design the best user experience possible. I'm experienced in copy testing, user interview, conducting workshops, as well as coming up with tones and personalities that fit the products.

The products that I've previously handled are: bill payment, experience, car rental (Traveloka products), b2b intranet website for car rental (ARIES Traveloka) and leisure companies (AXES Traveloka), food delivery service (GoFood) and restaurant partner app (GoBiz).
 
When I'm not working, I enjoy reading speculative fiction, watching wildlife documentaries and terraforming my Animal Crossing island.

name: Gabriela Cavalheiro
headline: Lead UX Writer & Content Designer at King (Activision Blizzard, Xbox) | Accessibility Practitioner | Ph.D.
creator: False
school_2: Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro
bio:
I translate meaning, usability, and storytelling to technology. I designed narratives with entrepreneurial businesses across Europe, including Circular IQ (Netherlands), Layer (Germany), Körber Digital (Germany), Microsoft (EMEA), and Unilever (global). I'm a Lead UX Writer / Content Designer at King (Activision Blizzard).

As a UX Writer, I craft UX texts for digital systems and products, I'm always wearing the user's shoes to design experiences that facilitate interaction, engagement, and learning. I'm an experienced researcher and a passionate data nerd, leveraging real user stories to make informed decisions. 

As a Content Designer, I develop strategies and creative solutions to align product stories and users' needs. In the organization, my goal is to ensure product developers, designers, and users all speak the same language. I also oversee product documentation and co-design information architecture.

I follow the principle that all design should be Inclusive Design. To me, Accessibility equals comfort and my goal is to make sure users feel welcomed, heard, and seen. I will always advocate for accessible and inclusive experiences and I’m a certified Able Gamers (APX) Accessibility Practitioner.

I'm an intercultural communicator with extensive experience working with multicultural teams in different countries, such as the Netherlands, Sweden, Turkey, and Spain. I love working with multidisciplinary teams! I also hold a doctorate (Ph.D.) in English / Cultural Studies from King's College London, which allowed me to fully exercise my passion for research, languages, and cultures.

name: Beatriz Castro Rodríguez
location: San Juan de Aznalfarache, Andalusia, Spain
headline: 🎮 Producer at King 🎮
creator: False
bio:
Llevo trabajando en QA desde hace 5 años en diferentes entornos y empresas que me han hecho aprender y saber adaptarme a las diferentes formas de trabajo. 
Me encanta trabajar en equipo y para mi, la comunicación transparente y sincera es esencial para mantener un buen entorno de trabajo donde el trabajo fluya por su cuenta. 
Para mí, mejorar la calidad del producto, previniendo y enseñando a los equipos de desarrollo de videojuegos son la clave para hacer evolucionar y crecer el producto que se desarrolla. Es por eso que creo en la asistencia de calidad (Quality Assistance) más que en el aseguramiento de la calidad (Quality assurance).

name: Steven Bartels
headline: Senior Lead Developer at King | Team Xbox | Microsoft
creator: False
bio: Coming from a mobile programming background I worked myself into Unreal Engine 4 since it was released. With a wide range of different projects, multiplayer (asynchronous/synchronous), mobile and desktop, as well as VR (Oculus and Vive) I feel comfortable in dealing with upcoming challenges. I always had the desire to organize and guide a team and make the best out of the given resources. Let's work together on the next big thing :)

name: Matteus Masullo
headline:
Desenvolvedor Front-end | Html | Css | JavaScript | 
React | Git | GitHub
creator: False
bio:
Ola👋🏻! Sejam Bem-Vindos. Sou Matteus Masullo desenvolvedor web, com experiência no setor de front-end e design de interfaces. Focando no desenvolvimento Front-End, onde liderou projetos de desenvolvimento de interfaces responsivas e visualmente atraentes, utilizando habilidades em HTML, CSS e JavaScript.
  
Minhas experiências incluem a criação de layouts intuitivos, experiências de usuário cativantes e a integração de tecnologias emergentes para garantir a qualidade e o desempenho dos produtos digitais. Onde comecei a trabalhar na empresa King desenvolvendo e ajudando no designer dos sites.

Além disso, procuro ser reconhecido por estar sempre em colaboração com a equipe e por compromisso com a excelência. Procuro sempre demonstrar minhas habilidades de comunicação, liderança e adaptação a novas tecnologias, o que me coloca como um talento de destaque e confiança no cenário tecnológico atual.

Atualmente estou cursando análise e Desenvolvimento de Sistemas e para agregar mais conhecimento investi em cursos como a Origamid e Alura. Onde estou aprimorando minhas habilidades como Dev.

Gostou de algum tema? Vamos Conversar! 💭

E-mail: matteusmasullo07@ gmail.com
GitHub: https://github.com/Masull0

name: Maximilian Pfaff
headline: Senior Product Manager @ King
creator: False
bio:
Working in the gaming industry and collaborating with talented individuals to create beloved entertainment is what continues to drive me after two decades. 
My focus lies in maintaining a balance between analyzing KPIs, identifying business requirements, and harnessing creativity to develop games that live up to their promises. 
I have gained valuable insights into various platforms and business models, including Free-to-Play, mobile apps, consoles, and PC games.
Whether creating new IPs from scratch or working with well known favorites like Game of Thrones, it always is about creating the right game for the right audience.

name: Sergio De Natale
headline: Ideating, designing, and delivering value to broad player audiences in the mobile space.
creator: False
bio:
Passionate and versatile designer that always strives to craft fun and compelling experiences out of game mechanics and engaging gameplay content.

Core Skills:

- Experienced in Mobile Games, Social Games and Browser Games design and development
- Able to design games from concept, prototyping to the entire production phase. 
- Broad game design knowledge that includes core mechanics, gameplay elements, user interface, level design and balancing across different genre of games.
- Knowledge of Unity, level editors and scripting tools.

name: Zarina Spencer-Geoghegan
headline: Associate Director at King
creator: False
bio: I am enthusiastic and ambitious, passionate about protecting the integrity of the creative while ensuring client expectations are consistently met or exceeded. I’ve worked on freelance and permanent contracts throughout my career and looking for my next new challenge. ​I have completed a Certificate in Management (1 year course, ​CMI Accredited - Level 5​), learning skills regarding managing and leading various teams and situations, how to coach and mentor. I’m a certified Scrum Master and have also completed an IPA LegsRegs course (learning about copyright, usage rights, licensing and more). For more details on projects I’ve worked on or if you would like to review case studies please contact me.

name: Marc Miquel
headline: Senior User Researcher @ Candy Crush Saga, King (Microsoft Gaming) | PhD, Lecturer
creator: False
bio:
I am a passionate User Researcher. I enjoy uncovering users' needs and motivations to improve their experiences. 

My objective is to deeply understand users to guide product design and contribute to shaping both product and business strategies.

I firmly believe that the best way to understand users is by integrating qualitative and quantitative methods, learning not just from what they say but also from what they do. Currently, I am focused on finding ways to ensure that User Research and Data Science work together successfully.

Additionally, I take pleasure in teaching user research through university courses and, in the past, I have dedicated time to writing academic papers.


Highlights:

• Senior User Researcher with 8+ years of experience in gaming, online communities, and services
• Experience in bridging the gap between qualitative and quantitative methods to understand the user
• Focus on research to evaluate the product’s design and create a compelling value proposition
• Previously, Data Scientist fluent in Python, big data processing, and data visualization libraries
• University course design and lecturing experience for user experience, game design and online marketing
• PhD in Human-Computer Interaction, published 5+ journal and 10+ conference papers

name: Brogan Jones
headline: Creative Lead at King
creator: False
bio:
I am a multidiciplinary designer and animator with over 13 years of experience in the industry. Being a multidiciplined, I have worked in many areas of design, ranging from static and print, to web design as well as actual development, and motion graphics and animation. I have a BA in Brand Communications and Marketing specialising in Creative Brand Comminications, as well as an MA in Character Animation.

My specialization has always been in working with brands on full campaigns, heading up projects that need a wide range of assets and mediums. Taking them from initial pitch and ideation through to storyboarding or concepting all the way to production and final implementation. 

I currently work primarily in motion graphics and animation, in a Video Creative role at King Games. Under our team lead, I head up the creation of videos on our team, liasing directly between the marketing stakeholders and the games team, working in Unity to get in-developement assets and create awesome animated videos from them in order to test the best way to position upcoming titles to become a success once launched. One of the main titles I have helped launch is Crash Bandicoot: On the Run!

name: Paul Lamy de La Chapelle
headline: Senior Game Artist (Art, Ai, 3D) @King 👑
creator: True
bio:
Hey! I'm Paul and I am Associate Principal Artist at King. 👑

Over the years, I’ve been working on a wide range of casual games: runners, match three, merger etc.
After spending some time working on Candy Crush, I’m now diving into creating exciting game prototypes that push the boundaries of creativity. 🕹

With a focus on Art, 3D, and AI, I'm always looking for new ways to bring fresh ideas to life and make every game feel unique. For me, it’s all about blending creativity with game design to create something memorable ✨

name: Tosca M.
headline: Senior AI Project Manager, AI Center of Excellence at King (Microsoft Gaming)
creator: False
bio:
As Senior AI Project Manager at King, my focus is on making AI accessible and impactful across the organization. I manage AI projects while promoting a culture of continuous learning and innovation. I believe AI is more than just a tool—it’s a resource to enhance our skills, knowledge, and overall productivity.

Previously, as Head of Partnerships for the APAC region at an ML-driven company, I developed a deep passion for how AI and tech can optimize systems and business processes. This sparked my interest in leveraging AI to create more efficient, inclusive, and scalable solutions.

With strong leadership, design thinking, and a commitment to driving efficiency and inclusion, I manage projects from ideation to completion, ensuring that AI use cases align with both business objectives and stakeholder needs.

In a rapidly evolving AI landscape, my goal is to make AI beneficial for all—championing diversity, fairness, and innovation in everything we do.

bio: I am a passionate and self-motivated user interface designer. Based in Lahore, Pakistan, I am a self-taught individual always looking forward to make myself better. Having hands on experience over multiple areas such as 3D assets modeling, texturing, rendering and post production, my expertise lies within the user interface design for video games, websites and mobile applications. bio: ¡Hola! Soy Andrea, UX researcher y designer apasionada por resolver problemas centrados en el humano.
