name: Sabrina Carmona
headline: General Manager, Farm Heroes Saga @ King | Leading $1B+ Mobile Game
creator: True
school_1: Pontifícia Universidade Católica de São Paulo
school_2: Pontifícia Universidade Católica de São Paulo
bio:
Sabrina Carmona is a VP at King, one of the world's leading mobile gaming companies, where she oversees Farm Heroes Saga, a $1B+ casual game with millions of players worldwide. She has over 15 years of experience in the mobile gaming industry, and holds a Master's degree in Communication and Media Studies and a Certified Scrum Master credential.

Sabrina is passionate about creating engaging and innovative games that deliver value and delight to players. She leads a diverse and cross-functional team of talented professionals, and applies her skills in user experience design, gamification, and player behavior to drive growth and innovation in the mobile casual space. She is also a champion of diversity and inclusion in the gaming industry, and fosters a culture of collaboration, creativity, and empowerment within her team and organization.

name: Bob Bowden
headline: Content Designer/UX Writer at King
creator: False
bio:
From a foundation rooted in customer care and technical support, traversing roles as diverse as a Personal Assistant, Wine Advice and evangelisation, and Technical Support, to pioneering fibre optic solutions as a Remote Engineer, my career has been a testament to my enduring passion for making the complex understandable. This journey, fueled by an intrinsic love for writing, art, and design, naturally evolved into a fervent pursuit of UX Writing and Design - where I've found my true calling in translating intricate concepts into user-friendly narratives.

At the heart of my approach lies a profound commitment to empathy, prioritizing player experience above all. My philosophy centers on speaking the language of the users, attuning to their needs, perceptions, and capacity for information, all while avoiding the pitfalls of condescension or cognitive overload. This player-first mindset has been the cornerstone of my work, from enhancing player support content for Candy Crush Saga to strategizing content that addresses player queries directly within the game environment.

My contributions to projects like 'Dice of Destiny' and 'Season Mastery' in Candy Crush Saga underscore my collaborative spirit. Working alongside a diverse team of UX writers, game designers, and stakeholders across sister brands, I've championed initiatives that significantly elevate the user experience. A notable achievement was revolutionizing our approach to event naming conventions, integrating player feedback, AI sentiment analysis, and a cross-functional workflow that enriched our creative process and reinforced our brand's legacy.

Despite a non-traditional entry into this field, my nine-year tenure is a reflection of an instinctive grasp of player needs and a deep-seated expertise in UX writing, which I consider my 'superpower'. My commitment to professional growth is unwavering, as I continuously engage with the latest UX design trends and dialogues, critically navigating the landscape to enrich my knowledge and skills.

My ambition is to further impact in shaping enchanting and intuitive gaming experiences. While my journey in UX is far from complete, I eagerly anticipate the challenges and triumphs that lie ahead in my quest to master the art of user experience design.

name: Dídac Magriñá Clemente
headline: Software Engineer
creator: False
bio:
I am an Industrial Engineer who enjoys solving Software problems. Amongst the contributions I have made during my career are:
•	developing critical components for embedded systems in the automotive sector
•	developing a component following the Precision Time Protocol (PTP) in the energy sector
•	debugging customer issues involving IETF protocols, e.g. SIP, in the video conferencing sector
•	expanding Python and C++ test frameworks
•	contributing to open source projects integrating and validating code

I am always eager to learn new technologies and methodologies. This is what drove me to course an MSc on Software Systems Engineering at UCL, to solidify the knowledge I gathered during my work in the industry.

Aside from coding at work, I like to spend time on my side project: a mobile app called Showtime. It is a way to play around with technologies and practices I do not have the opportunity to apply at work.

Specialities/Interests: C++, Python, Linux Environment, Git, Docker, Agile Software Development, Google Test

name: Carlos Martinez
headline: Senior Software Developer Engineer
creator: True
bio:
Smiling most of the time, yet paying attention to every detail in what I do, I'm a passionate person that enjoys working in diverse and interesting teams. Being a proactive person in the pursuit of improvement, made me a reliable person among my coworkers allowing me to take leadership positions. 

I have a wide experience in Java programming language, so I often give advice to my teammates when I find some room for improvement in them. Likewise they always have something to teach me.

I'm a fast learner, always trying to stand out and grow in my profession.

name: Isabel Lammens
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
headline: Junior UI Artist
creator: True
school_2: Centre de la Imatge i la Tecnologia Multimèdia | CITM (UPC)
bio:
Fluent in 3D softwares (3DS Max, Substance Painter, ZBrush, Unity 3D), experience working in teams using agile methodology and code repositories. 

Basic understanding of C# language.

3D artist who is very passionate about creating 3D environments (especially cyberpunk ones!) and fantasy inspired props. I've developed a few 2D games for game jams with friends, and currently starting to work on a new game for personal purposes - stay tuned!

name: Daniel Sävström
headline: Senior Software Developer @ King, with an agile mindset
creator: False
bio:
Highly skilled C++ developer with a strong background in many different industries and environments, with an added bonus of having worked as team lead, scrum master and solutions architect.

As a developer I have a keen sense of quality and good development practices. I have been part of regular discussion groups at my workplaces with the topic of improving software quality, and I have introduced ways of adding quality and structure to teams I have been a part of.

Being a scrum master and team lead has given me an interest for processes and ways of working in teams.

name: Ana Y. Romera
headline: QA Specialist at King
creator: False
bio:
I have experience working as a QA Tester and Visual Designer. I help companies produce and/or test exciting, meaningful, and valuable projects by understanding their beliefs and target market. In the future, I'd love to help the company to ensure the quality and fun of its games.

My passions are video games, movie/game trailers, and 3D/2D animation. I believe there is no better way to communicate someone's thoughts and feelings than by showing them on this type of media.

SKILLS:

• QA testing
• Test Plans & cases
• Bug tracking
• Defect fix & verification

SOFTWARE AND TOOLS:

• JIRA
• TestRail
• Jenkins
• Confluence
• App Store Connect & Google Play Console
• Trello
• Adobe Suite
• Unity 3D
• Autodesk Maya
• MS Office & Google Suite

name: Ville Ikäheimonen
headline: Design Director at King
creator: False
bio:
Two decades of game industry experience mainly with large-scale mobile/social companies has always kept me on the bleeding edge of gaming (from mobile to Facebook to F2P), always in the front row of the current massive tectonic shift in what games are and where they are heading to. It hasn't always been easy (or entirely original, to be honest), but it has always been what I like: a chance to collaborate with the smartest and most agile developers on the planet in a joint effort to bring gaming to the masses on an unprecedented scale. Hell of a ride and the best thing is I think it's just beginning.

Softography:

No Limit Casino 12-Pack (2007)
20Q: Mind Reader (2008)
20Q: Sports (2008)
20Q: Celebrity Quiz (2008)
Shopping Madness (2008)
High School Party Crashers (2008)
Mini Golf 99 Holes: Theme Park (2009)
Nightclub Fever (2009)
NanoStar Siege (2010)
Army Attack (2011)
SimCity Social (2012)
Unreleased Zynga IP (2013-, release date early 2015)
Angry Birds: Evolution (2017)
Small Town Murders (2020)

Currently working on my 14th title

Always nominated, seldom won:

GDC Online Awards Finalist (Best Social Network Game) - Nanostar Siege (2010)
Academy of Interactive Arts & Sciences Finalist (Social Networking GOTY) - Army Attack (2011)
Spike Video Game Awards Finalist (Best Social Game) - SimCity Social (2012)
16th Annual D.I.C.E. Award Winner (Web Based GOTY) - SimCity Social (2012)

name: Conor Patrick Souness
headline: Senior User Experience & Interface Design Consultant in Video Games
creator: False
bio:
🎮 Senior UX/UI Designer | Specializing in Video Games 

Passionate about creating immersive and intuitive user experiences for gamers. With many years of industry experience and multiple shipped games (box-product and live-service), I have honed my skills in designing compelling interfaces that enhance gameplay and captivate audiences. I craft scaleable and robust interfaces that can work on both console and PC friendly and in multiple languages.

🔹 Expertise:
- User-Centered Design
- Game Interface Design
- Interactive Prototyping
- Usability Testing
- Gamification Techniques

🔹 Achievements:
- Led the UX and UI design of award-winning games.
- Collaborated with cross-functional teams to deliver exceptional user experiences for AAA titles and indie games alike.
- Recognized for innovative solutions that seamlessly blend aesthetics with functionality.
- Helped ensure amazing IPs could work in multiple regions and languages.

🔹 Skills:
UI/UX Design | Adobe Creative Suite | Figma | Prototyping Tools | Game Development | Unity | Unreal Engine

Let's connect to discuss how I can help your games through design and user experience strategies.

---

🔹 Portfolio:

name: Oliver Acker
headline: Animation Pre-production Director | Art Director | Expert in Visual Narratives for Animation and Games
creator: False
bio: With over two decades in animation, games and VFX, my career began at Walt Disney Feature Animation, transitioned to universes like Star Wars at Lucasfilm, and evolved with innovative projects at Netflix and Eidos. My experiences range from Hollywood to emerging animation hubs in Asia and the Middle East, contributing to animated films, games, TV series, and commercials. This global journey has refined my skills and perspective, positioning me as a versatile asset to any creative endeavor.

name: Simone Pietropaolo
headline: Senior 3D Generalist at King
creator: False
school_2: Academy of fine Arts, Reggio Calabria (Italy)
bio:
My passion for drawing and graphic arts has been growing since childhood. I’m self driven in learning new skills and techniques, absorbing and learning from the world around me.

After I finished my studies in Italy, I worked as freelancer for a couple of years. I decided to move to London in order to live a big life experience, for my personal and professional growth.
In less than two years I have been able to improve my position from a Crew Member in a McDonald to head graphic designer of a big restaurant chain. 

As far as I’m proud of what I reached, I look forward to the next mountain to climb.

headline: AI Enablement Manager/ Principal Technical Writer / UX writer / Content strategist / Content designer / Information strategist
creator: False
bio:
I make complex technology easy to understand.
I always focus on the user using whatever method necessary to make you understand; tutorials, UX writing, videos, courses, meetups, API docs, blog posts, illustrations, and more.

I'm a firm believer in open-source and knowledge sharing and have co-started Stockholm Makerspace, and I'm organizing Write-the-Docs meetups in Stockholm.

name: Cyrus Lo
headline: Video Creative at King
creator: False
bio:
Cyrus Lo has worked on projects ranging from video advertisement and animated documentary, to interactive illustration and animated installation for singers' concerts. His clients include the Westfield Corp, Victoria and Albert Museum, Hostel World, celebrities in Asia such as Bibi Zhou and I Love You Boyz.
​Cyrus is an Animator and Motion Graphic Designer. In 2015 he began studying in the University of Art, London with a Bachelor Degree in Animation. He is also a 2014 graduate of Middlesex University with a Bachelor Degree of Media and Cultural Studies. His language skills are including English, Chinese (Cantonese and Mandarin) and Japanese.

bio:
- Leadership & Collaboration in both large teams and multi-team environments.
- Expertise in operational requirements, including team development, goal setting, and budget management at the VP level.

- Mastery of Game Design & Systems Design, with a strong focus on growth and player engagement.

- Product Vision & Strategic Planning, including product evolution, new product launches, and M&A assessment.
- Experienced in representing games and companies to C-suite executives, investors, media, and at industry events.

name: Madhumitha Venkatesh
headline: Senior Director Game Design- Candy Crush Saga
creator: False
current_position: Senior Director Game Design- Candy Crush Saga
bio:
I'm an experienced game designer with over 13 years in F2P spanning- puzzle, simulation, narrative hybrid, PvP strategy and MMORPG for girls. 

What drives me most is the pursuit of understanding and then channeling that into the work I do. Two of my biggest passions in life are, People and Design. 

I love understanding people, the ways of their inner workings as it enables me to nurture and support their growth as a manager. Similarly, I enjoy understanding the player base I'm working with, in order to create magic with the games I design.

name: Rasool Ahmadi
headline: Visual Development Artist at Activision Blizzard King
creator: True
bio:
I am a visual development artist, illustrator and Set designer.My main field of works is for Animation studios, game studios, publications and advertising agency.
Actually, when I was 6years old I knew one day I will be an artist because of nothing could be caused that I got happy except art.
I started with music and I used to play guitar when I was younger than now and after that, I joined to entertainment industry.
I think Animation, game and movie world is the strange places that you could make your dreams and definitely I try to be better than past every day because it's my dream.
It's important for me to create new worlds, new feeling and the new vision for my addressed.

headline: Game Artist at King
creator: False
bio:
As a Game Art Generalist, I do a bit of everything:

- I specialise in 2D Graphics and Character Design
- Basic 3D Modelling, Texturing 
- 2D and 3D Animation
- Logo and Icon design
- Basic experience in UI/UX

I have:

- Years of experience working in NewIP games and Prototyping
- Live game experience
- Worked on Educational Apps for children
- Experience creating graphics for Casino Games

I've worked my way around many software programs:

- Photoshop
- Illustrator
- Flash (may it rest in peace)
- Spine
- Maya
- Unity
- And an assortment of in-house engines and programs

name: Antubel M.
headline: Design Director
creator: False
bio:
I’m a product and design expert with 17 years of experience in development and publishing. I’ve led start-up and corporate teams to commercial success and critical acclaim. Including games with multi-million installs and revenue, as well as BAFTA, Golden Joystick and other award winners.

✅ COMMUNICATION & STORYTELLING: I convey complex topics in simple and engaging terms - whether walking through a feature with a teammate or pitching to a business partner.

✅ LEADERSHIP & ORGANISATION: I help navigate an ambiguous and uncertain future. I deﬁne products that anticipate the market, build high-performing teams and drive growth.

✅ CREATIVE PROBLEM SOLVING: I use quantitative, qualitative data, experience and intuition to deliver innovative solutions that go beyond budget, schedule and scope changes.

name: Veronica Anzola
headline: Freelance Senior Artist
creator: False
bio:
I am a BA (Hons) Senior Graphic Designer from Central Saint Martins, with an MA in Illustration and over ten years of industry experience. For the last three-four years I’ve been working as a Senior Freelance Designer at various advertising and marketing agencies in all kinds of projects from experiential marketing to conceptual design and key art creation, and the design of assets for new technologies like VR and AR experiences for global and national campaigns.

I am now looking to go back to a permanent role where I can grow as Designer and where I can add my expertise to the design and development of projects while progressing in my career as a creative.

headline: Principal Software Engineer - Game Engine at King
creator: False

bio:
He trabajado en diferentes áreas asociadas a IT como consultoría, testing, seguridad y desarrollo. 
En la actualidad y desde hace más de 8 años que trabajo como desarrollador C++ con énfasis en gráficos y 3D.

Me gustan las tecnologías abiertas, aunque no tengo dificultades para trabajar en ningún ambiente.

Mi interés radica en el desarrollo de motores de videojuegos, tecnologías multiplataforma y desarrollo de aplicaciones 3D en general.

name: Ari Vaniderstine
headline: Associate Product Director, Game Engine at King (Microsoft Gaming)
creator: True
current_position: Associate Product Director, Game Workflow & Environment
bio:
I'm a cross-functional communicator who bridges the gap between tech and product. 
I have technical background and 10+ years of experience with developer communities, developer platforms, and technical product development in agile environments.

I enjoy building, growing, and leading teams and products. I actively coach and mentor others inside and outside of my direct team, and I'm confident in navigating my teams and organisation through difficult changes, evolutions, or challenges.

I prioritise effective communication and relationship-building, both with stakeholders and with the members of my teams. Using my technical experience and communication expertise, I often act as a bridge and translator to ensure understanding and trust between teams and stakeholders, even in challenging or rapidly-changing situations.

My background in both hands-on development work and driving developer relations strategies has given me a deep understanding of the field of developer experience. I'm particularly enthusiastic about creating powerful products and platforms that empower developers.

----
NOT interested in software developer roles or industries related to blockchain and cryptocurrency.

name: Mirko Wolter
headline: Creative Lead Monetization & Economy - Candy Crush Soda Saga
creator: False
current_position: Creative Lead Monetization & Economy - Candy Crush Soda Saga
bio:
I'm a game designer with over 10+ years experience in the games industry working across multiple platforms and genres creating games for a variety of target audiences.

During that time I had the opportunity to support games through the entire product life cycle working on every facet of game design. From content and feature design all the way to system and monetization design.

I believe in a strong design ownership but also accountability. My design approach is data informed but also takes the human component into account. It's one thing to optimize numbers but another to also understand how this impacts the motivations and behaviors of your players. The entire product experience needs to be build from the ground up including extensive market research, competitor analysis and user research to inform game design to ensure the best possible game.

My passion for game design and curiosity for innovation in that field drives me to seek out new opportunities to further hone my skills and becoming more experienced. There are still lots of genres, features and mechanics out there that I hope to get the pleasure to work on in the not too distant future.


Specialties:
Conception and implementation of game design content, market research, system design, economy and monetization design, user research, gamification and design thinking

Skills:
Personal initiative, self-organization, creativity, flexibility, teamwork, reliability and high quality awareness

name: 🟠 Oscar Brusse 🟠
headline: Games UX & APX Researcher at King
creator: False
bio:
At a young age, I discovered my fascination for understanding people and trying to see the world from their perspectives. This became a focus point in all of the professional & personal experiences that followed throughout my life.

I am a Dutchman - currently living in Stockholm, Sweden. I love a good challenge and have a passion for life and its people. I am continuously interested in understanding what motivates their behaviours and improving their experiences from the perspectives of their needs. 

I am a UX & APX Researcher with an analytical mindset that has been shaped by years of practicing people-centric working approaches. I help well in the early stages of the design process, discovering opportunities and informing strategies, or while running relevant research during production, and translating research processes & data into actionable recommendations for stakeholders. 
During my years of education, as well as my recent years at King, I've gained a deep understanding for UX research & design methodologies which has made me very comfortable working in all stages of the design process, from initial strategic research to final validation & release. 

I bring valuable experience in interdisciplinary & people-centric work, gained through 13 years of project- and office management for events and 18 years of teaching international elite-level dance. 

Above all, I am a kind person who has learned much about respectful & empathetical communication while working with very diverse groups of people during all of these years.

My goal has always been to improve the lives of others, as a person, a manager, a teacher, and now also through research & design. 


The languages I speak & write fluently are English, Swedish & Dutch. 
#UXResearch #UXDesign #ServiceDesign

​

headline: Director of Engineering, Game Production at King

bio:

Currently leading and supporting the Engineering team of King’s only internal game engine which supports our biggest games and runs on millions of devices across multiple platforms. 

Led teams of up to 45 members including engineers, designers, product managers, and artists. 

Pro-active and team player, specialized in getting things done in a methodical and agile way.

Experienced in both freemium and retail products.

name: Viktor Andersson
headline:
UX-Researcher at King - New Games
(Xbox Activision Blizzard - Microsoft).
creator: False
bio:
Hello, my name is Viktor and I am a 30 year old UX Designer & Researcher, based in Stockholm.
I'm passionate about creating designs that empowers people and solves real problems.
With that said, I work mainly with game UX, Experience Design and research.
I do enjoy to climb, kayaking, videogames and hiking, I also do a lot of autodidactism in my spare time.

I have knowledge within these relevant areas of UX:
- UX design
- User reasearch & User testing
- Gamification & Game Psychology
- Game design & Game Thinking
- User centric design
- UI design
- Interactive design, Service design
- Prototyping & Wireframing
- Agile Project Methodology
- AR
- Analytics
  And more!

You can view my work at: https://www.originalviktor.com (Caution: On-going maintenance)

Feel free to get in touch! :)

name: Teodora Tasic
headline: Senior Creative at King
creator: False
bio:
Day 2514.

My name is Teodora Tasić and this is how many days I have ofﬁcially been called a designer. I am a very passionate Illustrator and Art Director.

I appreciate aesthetic values, precision and like adding a drop of humor into my work. I crave for knowledge, experiences and practice, and constantly challenge myself in ﬁelds I have never worked in. I enjoy the rush design creates, working with many different people and using my imagination on a daily basis. As Douglas Adams once said, “I love deadlines” (the rest of the quote is too fun to write). In my opinion they make design process all that more exciting and invigorating. They give me creativity when least expected, make me feel alive, make me feel as a designer. I am very dedicated to what I do and enthusiasm is the main part of my working atmosphere. I like to paint with pixels and see the world as my design playground. I have spent a lot of time searching and learning about my limits, and I still haven’t found them. 

“I am seeking, I am striving, I am in it with all my heart.”

name: Christy Bontrager
headline: Senior UI Artist at King
creator: False
bio:
I have a BFA in Animation/Illustration, with experience in the social games industry. My skill set includes using Photoshop, Illustrator, Adobe XD, and using in-house game engines to concept, create, and animate charming assets/FX/UI for mobile games and webgames. I have a great deal of experience with ISO grid based games and have created countless environmental and dungeon sets for both casual and midcore styles. I also have a background in teaching traditional art techniques to people of all ages. When not creating games I am illustrating and publishing my own comics.

•	Digital painting and vectoring with Adobe Suite
•	UI implementation in Game editor
•	UI mockups and prototyping
•      Experience with JIRA, Perforce, and fork

Specialties: Adobe PhotoShop, Adobe XD, In house editor for implementation of art/UI, Illustrator, InDesign, Clip Studio Paint, Miro

View my Art Portfolio: http://christymakesart.com/

name: Suhaib Dehneh
headline: VFX Artist | 3D Generalist
creator: False
bio:
Hi
I’m Suhaib Dehneh, recently graduated as a VFX Artist at Xenter Stockholm. With a background of graphic design (Studied and worked for 6 years in different agencies). I ‘ve done my internship at Resolution Games Ab ( Stockholm )as a VFX Artist and another studio as a Houdini Artist.
Now I’m open for new challenge and new journey as ( 3D generalist & VFX Artist ) 

I have spent my school time using VFX tools in general. The assignments I have worked on have each become passion projects. I have done quite a bit of work in composition weaving special effects into video. I am also adept at taking existing video and adjusting placement color and lighting. Self-motivated and enthusiastic I go after the best ways to produce visual effects. I’m really interested with your company as a VFX / CGI artist or FX Artist with a passion of Houdini ( simulation ) & procedural modeling - Maya & Substance painter with lighting & lookdev and modeling.
I've learned a lot though my intern ( live vfx - live simulation with Embergen - texturing - lighting - speed up my modeling and retopology - shading ...) I’m a self learner as well which I’ve spent all my time learning new tools and techniques.
#vfx #3d #job

name: Marc Hernandez
headline: VP Creative at King
creator: False
bio:
With 20 years of experience in the gaming industry on AAA and free-to-play models, combined with a technical (computer sciences) and artistic (cinema) background, I’m thriving on innovative and challenging projects putting quality first.

My main creative strengths are a coherent and comprehensive vision, original yet structured ideas, in-depth knowledge of game design, GaaS and UX methods.

I always strive to build a motivated, responsible and proactive team as, for me, it is the most important factor to develop an outstanding product. As a manager, I prefer to inspire, guide and empower rather than dictate, impose and enforce.

Fluent in English, French and Spanish

name: James Lane
headline: Senior Director Game Design
creator: False
bio:
Game Designer and Leader with over twenty years of professional experience working for some of the best in the industry. I have created experiences for console, PC, handheld and mobile platforms, encompassing the whole spectrum of design. From casual to core, first party launch titles and Free2Play mobile, I have had the privilege to work with some of the biggest and most complex technology and IPs in the industry including JK Rowling’s Harry Potter and Activision’s Call of Duty.

I have strong, proven experience building, growing, and leading design teams, and enjoy a calm, friendly and no-drama approach to team management. I love my profession immensely and enjoy the challenge of creating experiences to innovate, delight, and entertain players. Ideals I constantly impart to my teams.

name: Rabi Afram
headline: Engineering Manager / Product Owner
creator: False
bio:
Engineering Manager & Product Owner at King in Stockholm. I have previously worked as a Studio Design Manager, Engineering Manager and QA Lead in the video game industry. I am very people oriented and strive to create a working environment that others can thrive in. I wrote my thesis about puzzle design in adventure games and I have worked on several different projects that has spanned across several different platforms. I am used to working with agile development and have a knack for details. 

I also work a lot with pen and paper role playing game, creating systems and campaigns.

name: Damià Vazquez Abelló
headline: Senior UI/UX Artist en King
creator: False
bio:
I’m a passionate gamer and high committed game artist, with 15 years of experience in mobile games industry.

On these years, I have lived the evolution of the smartphones, which gives me a deeper  understanding in free to play market. 

I have been involved in all development phases of several successful titles such as MMA Profighter, Millionaire City and Galaxy Life, facing the challenges required in each phase, as well as creating new IPs like, Papa Pear Saga and Heroes of Mystia.

I contributed to the creation of King's Barcelona studio. As an Art Director I built a strong team, hiring and managing the artists in the studio.

I consider myself adaptable, pragmatic and creative which makes me a cooperative worker inside a high performing team.

name: Catt Mott
headline: Senior UX Writer at King
creator: False
bio:
Back in the early 2000's, when I was choosing the study paths that would shape my future, I was advised that arts were a waste of school time. Music and drama were easy subjects that would never get me anywhere.

Now, with technology ever-present in our lives, we are having to rethink our approach. From marketing to technical writing to UX, we're starting to demand new skills from our professionals:

Empathy.
Storytelling.
Creativity.
Vision.
Boldness.
Communication.

Suddenly, arts don't seem like such a waste.

name: Abigail Rindo
headline: VP, Head of Creative- Candy Crush Soda
creator: False
current_position: VP, Head of Creative for Candy Crush Soda
bio:
Abigail Rindo is a passionate storyteller and award winning game maker, working on more than 40 titles on various platforms in her career. Using her skills in creative direction and design, she has helped to create memorable new game worlds and worked with some of the most beloved IP in the world on entries like Candy Crush and Disney Heroes.  She believes that games can bring people together in meaningful ways through shared experiences and empathic design.

Advanced skills and experience in writing, game design, experience design, art and creative direction, product development, and studio management.

name: Karin Albons
headline: Seasons Lead på King
creator: False
bio:
Seasons Lead at King, part of our product marketing team, responsible for developing the strategy and vision for Seasons (time limited in app events) for one of the worlds largest mobile games - Candy Crush Saga. 

Previously I was Senior Digital Marketing and CRM Manager at King, working with multi channel content/marketing strategies and project management of Seasons. 

Prior to working at King I was Campaign Operations Lead at Creed Media, one of the fastest growing agencies in Sweden, connecting brands and music with youth culture.

name: Carina Nydén
headline: UX Writing at King, Candy Crush Soda Saga
creator: False
current_position: UX Writer at Candy Crush Soda Saga
bio:
I've spent 12+ years improving businesses and people's lives with technology and design. For the last 5+, I've specialized in Content Design and UX Writing to deliver innovative and impactful design solutions that improve user experience and business objectives. My work has moved metrics and solved business challenges - all while building user value, loyalty and trust.

I'm a passionate collaborator with a track record of solving (the right) problems with human-centered designs. I've co-designed in cross-functional teams and built partnerships with stakeholders throughout my career, which has given me strong communication skills. Using storytelling, facilitation methods, visualization, prototyping and wireframes, I can clearly showcase ideas, share customer research findings, illustrate concepts and more.

I've worked in product teams, at agencies and led agile development teams. It has shaped me to design experiences holistically, strategically and always with a firm foundation in insights from user research.

Expertise
| Content design | UX writing | UX | Usability | Interaction design | Information architecture | Voice and tone | Design-stage localization | Brand writing | Concept creation | Plain language | Storytelling | User research | Content strategy | Agile |

Soft skills
| Cross-functional collaboration | Communication | Facilitation | Building stakeholder partnerships |

Tools
| Figma | Lokalise | Notion | Writer.ai | Jira | Miro | Grammarly | Hemingway.app |

name: Alexander S.
headline: Driving Organizational Transformation
creator: True
bio:
Hello there, I’m Alex - a catalyst for organizational transformation and an advocate for a culture rooted in purpose, collaboration, innovation, and trust. I inspire and support remote, hybrid, and co-located organizations, teams, and individuals, emphasizing the power of clear communication, informed decision-making through diversity and inclusion as well as through data, and the role of happiness in achieving success.

For me, three words echo strongly: clarity, perspectives, and happiness.

#Clarity for me is more than just a buzzword. It's about inspiring everyone within a team or organization through aligned goals, ambitions, and values. By crafting a relatable, inspiring vision, and communicating it in a language _everyone_ can understand.

#Perspectives, I believe, are integral to the bigger picture. No single person holds the entire frame. Filling the gaps by fostering diversity, understanding how we all can contribute, and being conscious of our blind spots leads to not just humility, but also a drive to seek more data for better-informed decisions.

#Happiness is a personal KPI. I believe that there's a point in seeking joy in most things - be it experimenting or trying new, unexpected, and colorful approaches that supports the business. I strive to help organizations explore and minimize underlying or hidden distractions, letting everyone focus on doing what they love, improving it each day, and making meaningful contributions to the business. That's something that makes me want to get out of bed every day.

TL;DR - I'm a coach for leaders, teams, and organizations, propelling growth, agility, and the refinement of internal communication and work strategies. And loving doing it.

Key Skills and Experiences:

- Facilitation and visual collaboration
- Communication (team building, cross-team collaboration, improving team dynamics, understanding what matters to the business and to the people)
- 10+ years of practicing and teaching Agile methodologies
- UI/UX design (12+ years experience in casual and social games, business development, and in-game advertising)
- Bachelor of Arts in Educational Science (communication, usability, technology)
- Certified Scrum Product Owner & Scrum Master

name: Shawn Yap
headline: Lead Artist at King
creator: False
bio:
I'm a Stockholm-based, Singaporean Illustrator, game + concept artist and writer currently working for King/Activision Blizzard, and have worked for studios such as LambdaMu Games, gumi Asia and Singapore-MIT GAMBIT game labs.

I am also a published comic book artist and author, with 3 books currently in the market, in both digital and print formats - "Jack Doe: Anonymous" (2009), "Closets" (2010) and "Letters" (2013)


My other work experiences include:

Cover colors for Marvel’s Fantastic Four #642 (alternate color - Jim Cheung variant), working with the legendary Jim Cheung 

Collaborating on designs for Microsoft's exclusive "Internet Explorer T-shirt" and Singaporean band King Kong Jane's Debut album cover - "Waiting for Friday"

Working with Singapore-MIT Gambit Game Labs as a game artist for the mobile game "Dark Dot" (2011)

Freelancing for Ogilvy Singapore as an illustrator, visualizer and animator from 2005 onwards. Clients include Yahoo and IBM

Illustrating for board game "Dive! Diver! Die!" - published by Black Dove Games

Illustrating for What's Up Newspaper - for a joint project with Team Singapore

Apart from illustrations and comics, I'm also involved in game conceptualizations, and have been developing my own card game - "Crisis" 

-------------------------------------------------

name: Carlos Nogué
headline: Game 3D Artist
creator: False
school_2: Escola Llotja d'arts Aplicades i Disseny
bio:
I’m a 3D art guy from Barcelona who has been working in the mobile game industry since 2010.

I had the chance to work at several game companies on many different roles, such as environments, characters, vfx, lighting… and, more widely, managing Outsourcing, leading teams and a bit of art direction too. Also I have 10 years of Unity experience, developing production pipelines and creating prototypes for R&D

My best skills are that I can be very versatile, work in many areas with a good level, get the big picture in a project, build ideas from scratch, give them shape and turn them to a final production together with artists, designers and developers. Also I can deliver some nice stylized environments and VFX, which are my passion.

I've worked in several different genres, from MOBA to arcade games, strategy, sports, match-3, FPS and runners.

name: Mario Santos-Ramos
headline: Art Lead in Candy Crush Soda at King
creator: False
bio:
My goal in this industry is not only to challenge myself, but also to give others the best gaming experience possible inspired by those who made mine when I was a child. 


I have a passion and drive for the creative process, not afraid of trying new things, technologies and solutions. This understanding of the creation process made me appreciate all the hard work of the people involved in my gaming memories. It is with this passion for games and art, which has followed me since childhood, why I want to mix these two together into a challenging and exciting carrer.

Specialties: 3D modeling, Sculpting, Texturing, skinning, animation, concept art and character design

name: Nic Milligan
headline: Senior Video Creative at King | Activision Blizzard King
creator: False
bio:
Hi, I’m Nic! I'm a Senior Video Creative with over 10 years of professional creative experience.  I’m currently working at King, the video game company behind the hugely successful Candy Crush Saga. My passion lies in driving the creation of exceptional, engaging, and performing video content that balances both the user experience and storytelling with business objectives. 

One of my favorite aspects of my job is mentoring junior and mid-level creatives. I believe in an open and humble feedback culture and actively contribute to improving cross-team processes. I take the time to get to know my team members, and I help guide them to develop their skills and achieve their goals.

I'm passionate about finding new ways to improve the efficiency of our creative workflows. I’m always exploring and testing new tools and processes that can help automate and streamline our production pipeline, increasing our output without sacrificing quality.

name: Eva Prada Rodríguez
headline: Associate Art Director at King
creator: False
bio:
My goal is to lead and inspire teams to create exceptional designs and captivating content that resonate across all platforms.  

My 15 years of extensive creative experience, including a decade dedicated in the video game industry. With an outstanding track record in crafting highly effective marketing campaigns 
particularly tailored for the dynamic world of mobile games, I have honed my expertise in visual storytelling and strategic marketing.

I am passionate about harnessing the power of data-driven insights, UA, ASO, CRM, and Social/Community to not only boost user engagement but also to shape a brand’s image into a beacon of distinction.

My continuous exploration of emerging technologies, such as AI-driven creative applications fuels my commitment to driving pioneering campaigns that set new industry standards.

name: Martin Petersson
headline: Art Producer at King
creator: False
bio: I would summarize what I do as running projects and solving problems. As a freelancer I've worked with everything from sound design to web design. During my years in the gaming industry I've worked in Technical Art, where my main strengths have been workflow and tooling. Recently I transitioned into production leadership working tightly with Game Artists, Visual Effects Artists and Technical Artists to make sure that we deliver on time, with high quality and that our team is highly motivated.

name: Jonathan González Gómez
headline: Senior Artist - Candy Crush Saga
creator: False
bio:
I'm a Senior 2D Artist currently working at King. Previously I spent five years at Socialpoint (Take2), a mobile game company in Barcelona, Spain. I also spent three years as a 2D Artist in Winko Games (Barcelona) and before that I was a freelance artist providing character design for games and cover art for multiple books, including Catalyst Game Labs (Battletech) and CoolMiniOrNot as clients.

I'm passionate about Art and one of my biggest assets beside of my drawing skills is having a problem-solving attitude and a great sense of team-playing.

name: Teneka King
location: New York, New York, United States
headline: Creative Director (Art) + Designer | Exp: TikTok, BBDO, Instagram, Microsoft, AFROPUNK, Conde Nast, H&M, Keep a Child Alive | Inquiries welcome
creator: False
bio:
As a Creative Director and Designer, I’ve always had an immense passion for design and storytelling. I don't just create advertisements; I create art to captivate the senses. No matter the project or campaign, I set out to craft culturally resonant work that stirs emotions and ignites contemplation.

The world is boundless and as a globe-trotting enthusiast, I’m forever fueled by the wonders of travel and the experiences of people from all walks of life. Born and bred in the heart of Montreal, I spent 14 years honing my talents in the advertising capital of the world, New York City. Presently, I call the enchanting streets of Paris home and my creative haven, where I've spent the past year working remotely. 

Across my years of experience, I've had the opportunity to partner with incredible artists, athletes, and cultural innovators like Alicia Keys, Pharrell, NAS, Snoop Dogg, Ricardo Tisci, Chance the Rapper, Tyga, Saweetie, and more. I’ve led and collaborated with cross-functional teams for some of the most influential brands in the world, such as TikTok, Microsoft, Meta, PepsiCo, Pearl Milling Company, FX, Starz, Dove, Afropunk, and more.  

Now, the stage is set, and I'm ready for my next adventure. Whether it's remote freelance collaborations or a full-time partnership, I'm open and eager to embrace all opportunities that come my way. Let's connect and embark on a creative journey to make art that moves the world.

name: Guillermo Badolato
headline: Senior Composer & Sound Designer for Games, Film, TV & Advert.
creator: False
bio:
Website - Audio/Video demos/Endorsements/Credits:
www.BadolatoMusic.com
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Full-time professional Composer / Sound Designer / Guitarist for Videogames, Film, TV, Advertising and diverse media since the 90s. Musicians Institute full marks graduate (Hollywood, Ca.) Guitar Institute of Technology.

Full service in music composition, arranging, sound design & voice over recording for all media in any style. Many works currently worldwide broadcasted over 35 countries

Would like to highlite the ability to deliver full live symphonic orchestra and digital orchestra scores, as well as high energy crunch guitar, techno, electronica, pop, drum´n´bass tracks and other modern styles. Member of the Game Audio Network Guild from 2004.

Original Soundtracks, Sound Design, SFX and Voice Over for:

- Videogames: Xbox, Playstation, Nintendo, PC and all modern platforms
- Film & Animation (music to picture, film scoring )
- TV & Advertising (spots, corporate image, documentary, audio logos... )
- Multimedia (cd-roms, internet audio... )
- Audio Direction & Supervision
- Album production for bands & artists

Specialties: 

- Sound Design.
- Creating original and unique voices for new IP´s.
- Action soundtracks, Orchestral, moving themes and soundscapes for Motion Picture, Film, Cinematics, In-game complex multilayered music, Trailers. 

- Orchestral, Electronic & Guitar-driven hybrid tracks & scores.
- Music Composition and Production.
- Sound Design, sound effects, sound scapes.
- Voice over direction, recording & production.
- Editing.
- Mixing and Mastering.

name: M Hani Kanani
headline: Performance Marketing Analyst at King
creator: True
bio:
As an Enterprise Customer Success Manager at Replai, I manage all post-sales activities for strategic global accounts, helping them leverage the power of video intelligence to optimize their app marketing campaigns. With a background in mechanical engineering and data analysis, I bring a unique perspective and skillset to the customer success team.

I have successfully grown my managed accounts 10X through upsells, cross-sells, and renewals, building and maintaining strong relationships with high-level executives and key stakeholders. I also travel to conferences and customer offices to provide business strategy, training, and industry best practices, as well as acting as an advocate for customers internally, influencing product development through valuable feedback and needs. I am passionate about delivering customer satisfaction, loyalty, and advocacy, and enabling clients to achieve their goals.

name: Rodrigo Simas
headline: Data Scientist @King | ModulAI | KTH
creator: False
bio:
As a Portuguese Computer Scientist based in Stockholm, Sweden, I bring a unique set of skills and experiences to the table. With expertise in a wide range of programming languages, scientific research, teaching, and a passion for Artificial Intelligence and Video Games, I'm excited to explore opportunities at innovative companies in these fields.

During my undergrad studies, I developed a solid foundation in computer science and gained expertise in a wide range of topics, including Algorithms and Data Structures, Object-Oriented Programming, Databases, Web Development, Operating Systems, Compilers, Computer Networks, Logic and Artificial Intelligence, Computer Graphics, and Distributed Systems.

In my post-graduate studies, I focused on my true passions: Machine Learning, Video Games, and Computer Graphics. During my exchange semester at KTH - Royal Institute of Technology, I deepened my knowledge of artificial neural networks and learned about scientific methodology and philosophy.

In my MSc Dissertation, titled Multiple-Modality Associative Memory: a framework for Learning, I proposed a biologically constrained Artificial Neural Network Architecture that serves as a flexible learning framework for several Machine Learning Tasks with an efficient and simple Hebbian Training Rule. This research project is currently under review at Elsevier's Neurocomputing journal, and the manuscript is linked below in my profile (see Machine Learning and Computational Neuroscience Researcher).

In addition to my technical skills, I have a passion for teaching and have experience as a self-employed Maths Tutor and a volunteer Programming teacher for young kids at TreeTree2. This background has cultivated in me a passion for learning and sharing knowledge.

Most recently, I joined the Lighthouse Team in KPMG Sweden as a Data Engineer/Scientist, where I focused on ETL processes using Python and Microsoft Azure, as well as developing Machine Learning models for time series forecasting.

With my strong technical skills, passion for Data, AI, and Video Games, and experience in data engineering and scientific research, I'm excited to take on new challenges in innovative companies in these fields. Let's connect and explore potential opportunities!

name: Todd Green
headline: GM Candy Crush Franchise at King
creator: False
bio:
I lead the Candy Crush Franchise, and serve as a member of King’s leadership team. 

King was acquired by Microsoft in November 2023, as part of the largest ever technology acquisition ($75bn). 

Today: I enjoy structuring, simplifying, and solving complex problems. I have moved from product leadership into general management roles. Right now I am focused on creating great experiences for players by building high-performing and healthy organisations.

King: I joined King in January 2013, at the start of a period of hypergrowth (scaling from 200 to 2000 people within 2 years). We then went public in a $7bn IPO – one of the largest ever for a European tech company at the time - and two years later King was acquired by Activision Blizzard. I spent more than six years leading the Candy Crush Saga team.

Fremantle: Before joining King, I worked in digital innovation at Fremantle, one of the world's top TV producers. Our small team created three shows that were (as far as we could tell) world-firsts in interactive entertainment. 

BBC: Before TV and games I worked in radio, at the BBC World Service. I started on work experience aged 14-15, and became a paid researcher in my school holidays aged 16-17. 

Misc: I have been granted a US patent for original work on social feature design, co-authored a paper in a peer-reviewed academic journal, and created and taught a top-rated university course.

name: Diego Garcia Cardo
headline: Regular QA Specialist at King
creator: False
bio:
I am a Video Game QA who enjoys observing the works behind the scenes: how the environments are set, how the dialogue works or how the AI thinks. I have strong skills such as Organization, Creativity or Communication. I also have an academic background in Games and Interactive Media Design, having one self-published game on Steam, M.A.R.S.S., and I have participated in top Industry’s Titles, such as Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege, Candy Crush Friends, Candy Crush Jelly and other titles from King.

During my studies, I've had the opportunity of experiencing different roles, from QA Test and Game Designer, to different areas such as 3D Modelling, Writing or Programming.

With video games I want to tell a story, but specially one that can cause an impact in the public, and stand out from the rest.

name: Sara Lenkey
headline: Engineering Manager/ Agile Coach / QA Coach/ Transformation Coach
creator: False
bio:
I'm a goal oriented manager and coach that wants to have fun at work through collaboration, engagement and trust.

My educational background is in engineering with a special interest in Lean. As a coach I have found that it is not uncommon for teams to end up in stressful situations with almost nothing to deliver as a result of unclear work methodology, communication and requirement specs. Agile methods and requirements management (education) have been successful tools that I have used to avoid this, with increased efficiency, better quality and fewer misunderstandings as a result.
With a constant focus on improvements and optimisation of flows has given me and the teams the ability to identify and fix bottlenecks and unnecessary steps in the work. 
I have built my technical foundation by working close to the developers for 15 years. I have a good understanding of the importance of working with the technical debt, having a good code design, technical architecture and a clear technical vision for the teams to be able to scale and deliver with high quality and better cadence. I have always been curious and want to learn more within the technical area and has during my spare time studied JavaScrip at Folkuniversitetet, SQL and Object orientation. I have also done a small micro service together with two developers.

The foundation of my leadership is teamwork, participation, clarity, transparency and communication. My drive, energy and determination to reach the goals are important assets in motivating others.
